Bli en del av vårt växande internationella team, där varje dag är en möjlighet att bidra till något meningsfullt.
 



  





 Vårt NOC-team är placerat på vårt huvudkontor, och den här tjänstens karaktär innebär att primärt arbete på kontoret. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler vid Telefonplan i Stockholm och du kommer välkomnas till ett gäng som trivs på jobbet och har kul tillsammans!
 



  





**Om processen** 




 Vill du vara med på vår resa? Sök tjänsten genom att bifoga ditt CV och besvara några frågor.
 



 För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta, Daniel Rylin, 070-166 3185.
 



  





 Vi arbetar kompetensbaserat genom hela processen och det inkluderar arbetspsykologiska tester, intervjuer och referenstagning. Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla våra anställda, och du måste vara berättigad att arbeta i Sverige. Denna tjänst är säkerhetsklassad och en säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
 



  





**AddSecure** 
 är en ledande europeisk leverantör av säkra IoT-uppkopplingar och end-to-end lösningar. Vi hjälper våra kunder att optimera sin verksamhet, skapa affärsvärde och säkra viktiga funktioner. Våra lösningar inom pålitlig övervakad larmöverföring uppfyller kraven för att övervaka larmsignaler med högsta säkerhetsnivå. Vårt arbete gör skillnad och räddar liv.

title: 1-line supporttekniker till MUST
description:
**Must söker 1-line supporttekniker**
 Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld? Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Den Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver verksamhet inom försvarsunderrättelsetjänst, militär underrättelsetjänst och militär säkerhetstjänst.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning tre timmar i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet att ha
   

  

 balans mellan fritid och arbete.
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Inhämtningsenheten som är en del av underrättelsekontoret söker dig som vill utmanas och arbeta inom en rörlig och spännande underrättelsearena. I den här rollen får du kombinera dina tekniska kunskaper samtidigt som du bidrar till unika underrättelser till våra uppdragsgivare. Inhämtningsenheten uppgift är att bedriva inhämtning av information från multipla källor till stöd för Musts produktion och verksamhet. För att möta ny tekniska utmaningar behöver vi expandera vår teknikgrupp. Därför söker vi nu dig som vill vara med att utveckla verksamheten tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetsuppgifter i din roll som IT-tekniker med inriktning mot drift och användarsupport arbetar du i huvudsak för en säker och effektiv drift av förekommande IT-system samt hjälper användare med deras IT-problem. Du arbetar löpande med att säkerställa att driftmiljön är stabil samt kontrollerar,
   

  

 testar och driftsätter nya systemfunktioner och uppgraderingar. Att vara hjälpsam, känna ansvar och vara öppen för att sätta sig in i nya tekniska lösningar är viktiga egenskaper för denna tjänst. En stor del av jobbet kräver att du, förutom god teknisk förståelse, har förmågan att samarbeta med
   

  

 analytikerna på inhämtningsenheten. I vardagen har du även kontakt och samarbetar med många olika personer och funktioner internt såväl som externt. Arbetet påverkas i hög grad av den snabba teknikutvecklingen. Vidareutbildning och kompetensutveckling är därför en naturlig del av verksamheten. En dag i veckan avsätts för dig att kompetensutvecklas inom relevanta områden och till att vidareutveckla metodik, verktyg och prototyper för att hitta nya sätt att ta sig an dagens och morgondagens utmaningar.
   

  

 Resor inrikes och utrikes förekommer i tjänsten.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Gymnasieexamen med godkända betyg
* Minst 2 års yrkeserfarenhet inom IT
* God kunskap om Microsoft operativsystem för server och klient.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med daglig drift av IT-system
* Erfarenhet av att ge användarsupport inom IT
* Kunskaper inom hårdvara
* God kunskap i både svenska och engelska, såväl muntligt som skriftligt


**Meriterande**
* Kunskaper inom Linux
* Kunskaper inom PowerShell
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp nya IT-system
* Erfarenhet av att ge utbildning
* Erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av försvarsmaktens IT-system
* Arbetat inom säkerhets-/underrättelsetjänst.
* Körkort B


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som har engagemang, är serviceinriktad, har lätt för att ta kontakt med människor och
   

  

 har god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift. Du är en god lagkamrat samtidigt som du gärna tar
   

  

 initiativ, arbetar självständigt och tar eget ansvar.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt den värdegrund som finns. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika
   

  

 värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på
   

  

 www.forsvarsmakten.se).
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare som inleds med provanställning om sex månader
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Ovan ställda kvalifikationer ska på begäran kunna verifieras genom intyg, referenser samt arbets- eller urvalstester.
   

  

**Upplysningar**
 Frågor om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kan mejlas till: hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen skriv ”1-line IT support” i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga representanter är Anders Markow för SACO, Roger Ericsson för OFR/O, Katarina Kruse för SEKO samt Maria Ekelund för OFR/S, vilka nås via 08-788 75 00.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast 2024-08-19. Din ansökan ska innehålla cv samt ett personligt brev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning. Du ansöker via jobb.forsvarsmakten.se
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Data Solution Architect
description:
**Are you a seasoned Data Solution Architect looking for an exciting opportunity to shape the future of healthcare solutions? Falck Corporation is seeking a dynamic and experienced Data Solution Architect to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you will work with building our new core healthcare system for the ELM (Employee & Labor Market) business unit.**
 Currently, Falck is undergoing a transformative journey aimed at digitalizing, optimizing, and enhancing our operations. Substantial investments are being channeled into the upgrading of our core IT infrastructure and the development of new global digital capabilities. These initiatives are designed to position Falck for future success by enabling us to deliver even more effectively.
   

  

 Within the Employee & Labor Market Scandinavia business area, which focuses on healthcare services, Falck is in the process of establishing an agile delivery team for our new core functional platform. This platform is set to offer shared services across the business unit, initially supporting the Nordic region. Importantly, it is designed with scalability in mind to align with our growth ambitions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
 As a Data Solution Architect at Falck, you will:
   

  

* Drive Solution Design: Develop robust solution architectures aligning with organizational goals, providing detailed technical specifications, and creating architectural diagrams.
* Structure Data for our new system, ensure that data can be used as an asset by default when we develop our new core platform.
* Design and implement:
+ Business Intelligence
+ Master Data
+ Data Quality management

* Act as an advisor and architect for data and AI solutions
* Mitigate Risks: Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate challenges associated with the proposed solution.
* Promote Collaboration: Work in tandem with development teams, Falck data team, business analysts, and project managers, fostering effective communication and collaboration.
* Maintain Quality Assurance: Establish coding standards, best practices, and quality assurance processes, ensuring the overall quality of the solution.
* Address Scalability and Performance: Design scalable solutions and optimize system performance for future growth.
* Prioritize Security: Integrate security best practices into solution design, addressing potential vulnerabilities.
* Documentation Excellence: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for the solution architecture, ensuring accessibility and understanding.
* Client Interaction: Collaborate with clients, understanding their needs and presenting proposed solutions clearly.
* Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, driving continuous improvement and optimization of existing solutions.


**Requirements:**
* Proven experience as a Data Solution Architect, preferably in the healthcare or regulated domain.
* Expertise in agile delivery models and working with agile frameworks.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
* Familiarity with industry standards, regulations, and compliance including GDPR.
* Are articulate in writing and speech in Swedish and English
* You recognize yourself in our Winning Behaviours;
* We are committed to care
* We build trust
* Together, we create more value


**Are you interested?**
**Please submit your application by 11th August. I** 
 nterviews will be hold in the second part of August.

title: Marketing Analytics and Performance Manager
description:
*Do you consider yourself a skilled marketing generalist with a love of data, performance optimization and technology? Then you may well be the new Marketing Analytics and Performance Manager that we are looking for to join our Nordic marketing team.*
 As part of GlobalConnect Marketing Operations you will spend your time on everything from lead generation optimization and data management to website design and campaign insights.
   

  

 We are a Pan-Nordic marketing team, offering you a chance to work with and learn from colleagues in Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Germany. We aim to build an innovative and inclusive environment in our team, where testing new ideas and implementing new technologies are a part of our natural learning curve. GlobalConnect is on an exciting journey towards building an even stronger brand in the Nordics – and we would like you to join us.
   

  

***In this role you can be located in any of our headquarters in Copenhagen, Stockholm, or Oslo.***
 As a Marketing Analytics and Performance Manager at GlobalConnect you will be deeply involved in our daily Marketing Operations, bringing insights to help elevate the results of our initiatives.
   

  

**On a normal day, you may be the:**
* Data Detective: You will analyse marketing results from campaigns across digital and analogue channels. Your responsibilities encompass the assessment of these activities' efficiency with a focus on target tracking and the generation of better results. digital
* Insights Guru: You will provide the team with actionable insights to fuel data-driven strategic decisions. You will dive deep into users, traffic sources, behaviour, conversions, and other data points to provide a solid data foundation.
* Report Wizard: You will create detailed, well-presented, and crystal-clear reports on KPI’s and campaigns, ensuring we always know our position.
* Optimization Explorer: In collaboration with Head of Marketing Operations, you will utilize your data insight and curiosity to find new ways to optimize on existing performance.
* Website Wonder: Perform light support of our website functions for our team (WordPress).
* Project Sidekick: Assist the Head of Marketing Operations with project management in exciting new initiatives.
* A/B Campaign Tester: Assist both the Campaign team and the Inbound team with A/B tests and evaluation of design and content.
* and more.


 We are looking for a person who is curious, loves digging into complex data, and unearths insights to inform marketing and campaign strategies. Thriving in a setting where you handle tasks and projects without constant guidance and staying motivated is essential. In your role as a marketing generalist, you're well-versed in data analytics and equally enthusiastic about investigating the diverse elements that the marketing domain offers, always eager to gain insight and encounter fresh ideas. It’s important to engage in positive relationship-building with both internal team members and external collaborators. Being detail-oriented is crucial, with a natural eye for details and a comfort in sharing observations and learnings with your team.
   

  

**You have:**
* A Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Statistics, Economics or a related field. A Master’s Degree is a bonus.
* 3-5 years of experience in marketing analytics, data analysis, marketing performance optimization or a similar role.
* Proven experience in generating actionable insights from data to drive strategies.
* Familiarity with performance marketing, including PPC, SEO, SEM and social media advertising.


 If this sounds like you, please send us an application and we will go through your application during the summer and contact you as soon as possible. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: Business Controller to Samsung!
description:
At Samsung, our passion for excellence drives us to develop top products and services. In a fast-paced global economy, constant change and innovation are vital. For 80 years, we have anticipated market needs to ensure long-term success. As a Business Controller, you'll play a key role in keeping us market leaders and enhancing consumers' lives.
 


  


 Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Samsung
 



  

**City :**
 Kista
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, 40h/w
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP – on-going
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 We are a team of 5 Business Control professionals who drive the cost controlling and investment planning at Samsung Electronics Telecom division. On a daily basis, we liaise with multiple key stakeholders throughout the organization, from VP:s and CFO to Account Managers & various Area Experts such as Product Managers and System Developers. Understanding the big picture is key to deliver smoothness into the company operations.
 


  


 The main mission for the Business Controller is to support the process of optimizing sales, finding cost efficiency and improving profits. We achieve this mission by controlling the cost related to investment towards market and customers, improving related processes and tools, providing reports and analysis and being spider in the web supporting different stakeholders.
 


  


 The main product group this Business Controller will work with is Samsung Nordic’s IM business, i.e. within the product groups of smartphones, wearables, accessories and tablets.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Forecasting & closing activities of sales deduction costs, i.e the contracted and non-contracted activities towards the customers, ensuring that the rolling forecast reflects expected costs accurately and budget is controlled.
  
* Ensure sufficient accrual levels
  
* Support daily business through budget management
  
* Perform analysis
  
* Provide process guidance to the organization
  
* A supporting role for coordination in various improvement projects, such as our quarterly price planning process development and efficient reporting tools
  
* Business analysis and reporting for management (incl. European HQ & Global HQ), along with other ad-hoc assignments from the Business Control Manager (IM).
  

  


**We are looking for**

  

**You who:**



  

  
* You are analytical and accurate, structured, business oriented, and have great communication skills
  
* You have excellent skills in excel together with interest and understanding of systems and datasets
  
* You have worked for about 2-5 years with similar responsibilities
  
* You have a bachelors or master’s degree in finance or accounting
  
* You are fluent in English, in both speaking and writing
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* SAP knowledge (or similar ERP systems)
  
* Working with databases
  
* Deadlines
  
* Running projects
  
* Good knowledge either in Swedish or Korean is a plus
  


  


 Knowledge can be gained through education, experience or self-taught.
 


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* High sense of responsibility
  
* Perseverance
  
* Reliable
  
* Open minded and flexible
  
* Good at working with changing priorities and solution oriented
  


  


 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast moving industry, there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a person who appreciates tempo, change and to take own initiatives.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Samsung**

 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast moving industry, there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a person who appreciates tempo, change and to take own initiatives.
 


  


 "At Samsung, we deliver a superior experience every time by providing innovative customer solutions that drive retention and sales. It's the small details that make the major changes. By working together and focusing on the end-to-end Customer Journey, we constantly improve the Customer Experience."
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Julia Cenner or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv5@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105741

title: Compensation & Benefits Manager at Saab
description:
*Saab is a place where teamwork makes things fly. Literally. Join us and experience our supportive and friendly workplace.*
**Your role**
**Employment rate:** 
 This is an 11-month temporary employment due to parental leave, starting in November 2024.
   

  

 As Compensation & Benefit Manager, you will be part of an experienced team responsible for all remuneration related tasks for the Group, including the Long-Term Incentive Programs and the Global Mobility function. The position requires you to be highly collaborative as you work closely with both internal and external partners on all levels.
   

  

***Main tasks include:***
* Coordinate and prepare material for Remuneration Committee and Board meetings as well as for the Annual Report, Remuneration Report and Annual General Meeting
* Develop and co-lead the yearly cycle process of the Annual salary review and Gender equal pay analysis
* Handle the administration and development of our Long-Term Incentive programs
* Lead the implementation of the Pay Transparency Directive
* Project lead our development efforts in areas such as benefits, incentive programs, pension schemes, flexible working and vendor management
* Oversee the Group job architecture framework and ensures consistent practices around job evaluation and compensation benchmarking
* Drive the digital and global development journey of the Group’s remuneration processes
* Act as a trusted advisor on executive compensation matters and decisions


 Domestic travels will occur.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 As a person, we believe that you are solution-driven using creative and diverse ways to approach a problem or answer a question. You have good analytical skills and demonstrate confidence, credibility, and good judgment. Further, you are able to adapt to shifting priorities, demands and deadlines, and can deliver high quality and accuracy even under time pressure.
   

  

****Required qualifications and skills:****
* University degree preferably within Law, or HR, Business, Engineering or similar
* A minimum of 4 years of Compensation and Benefits related experience and/or 4 years of Global Mobility or HR experience
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, both verbal and written
* Strong proficiency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required
* Experience of working with problem solving and complex processes, and comfortable in working with numbers and conceptualization
* You are used to handle delicate topics with discretion and high integrity
* A solid HR knowledge and financial interest is key


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Head of FP&A
description:
*Are you ready to rock the finance world with your analytical expertise and business insight? At Visit Group, we're not just another finance team—we’re a collective of innovative thinkers and creative minds. From the drum set in our reception to the guitars and art decorating our walls, our office shows a vibrant, artistic energy that mirrors our dynamic company culture. Recently partially acquired by a leading PE firm, we're on a thrilling growth journey, and we want you to be part of it!* 




  





  





**Your role** 




 As our new FP&A Controller, you’ll be a pivotal player in our Group Finance team. This role is all about strategic financial planning, analysis, and business partnering to drive performance and provide insightful guidance. You'll work closely with the Group CFO at our Gothenburg headquarters.
 



  





  





**Main tasks & responsibilities** 



* Drive performance visibility for the company and the Group, internally and externally, including Board reporting.
* Manage operational responsibilities across various geographies, gaining international exposure.
* Implement and refine models for operations, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Lead the forecasting and budgeting processes at a consolidation level.
* Actively participate in the month-end close process, ensuring timely and accurate reporting.
* Translate KPIs into actionable insights for the management team, refining business strategy and decision-making.
* Develop a single source of truth for data, create dashboards, and leverage data in forecasts and performance analysis.



  





  





**Your profile** 




 To thrive in this role at Visit Group, you'll need to be a collaborative team player with a passion for driving business success. Your natural curiosity and initiative will help you develop the business further. A strategic mindset, strong motivation, and excellent problem-solving skills are essential. You should be adept at analysing complex data and communicating insights effectively across all levels of staff.
 



  





  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of experience in FP&A roles
* FP&A Operational responsibilities across multiple geographies (ideally Europe) with international exposure
* Experience in implementing operating models, budgeting and forecasting models
* Prior experience of working in an investor-backed business (PE, VC or similar) and be a key point of contact for Board reporting and shareholders relations
* Experience in a high-growth software or SaaS company.
* MS Excel skills, and familiarity with ERP systems (Visma experience preferred)
* Fluent in both English and Swedish, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.



  





  





**About Visit Group** 




 At Visit Group, we foster an entrepreneurial environment where innovation and initiative are celebrated. We believe in learning from mistakes and encourage employees to try new things. You'll have the opportunity to grow within your role and the organization, potentially forming your own team.
 



 We offer flexible working hours and a blend of home and office work, though we love seeing our team in the office most of the time. Our office is not just a place to work; it’s a place to connect. We work out together twice a week and share breakfast once a week, reinforcing our strong team spirit.
 



 Read more about us www.visitgroup.com
 



 Ready to join a finance team that rocks? Apply now and let’s create something amazing together!
 



  





  





**Join us?** 




 In this recruitment process Visit Group partner with SEVR Finance Recruitment. For more information, please feel free to contact the responsible recruitment consultant Elin Lindén on 0721-74 66 75 or elin.linden@sevr.se or Anna Klimenko on 0793-34 13 37 or anna.klimenko@sevr.se.
 



  





  





 Interviews and selection process will be ongoing, so please send us your application as soon as possible. We are looking forward hearing from you.

title: Teknikspecialist med fokus IT-övervakning
description:
**vid IT-avdelningen. Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-12.**
 Vill du vara med och utveckla Stockholms universitets övervakningssystem och få en nyckelroll?
   

  

 Just nu förstärker vi vår IT-avdelning på Stockholms universitet genom att bygga upp en strategisk funktion för övervakning. Här kommer du att få en spännande roll och utgöra en viktig del i den tekniska utvecklingen.
   

  

 Vill du dessutom arbeta i en komplex och spännande IT-miljö och har ett intresse av att göra samhällsnytta för ett av världens 200 främsta lärosäten, ja då är vi platsen för dig. Som Teknikspecialist kommer du bidra till att stödja universitetets kärnverksamhet inom utbildning och forskning. Låter det spännande så sök rollen som Teknikspecialist med placering på IT-avdelningen vid Stockholms universitet!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du kommer ingå i ett team som ansvarar för större delen av SU’s servermiljö. Arbetet är fritt, flexibelt, utmanande och erbjuder skiftande arbetsuppgifter med goda vidareutvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi söker nu en medarbetare som kan komplettera teamet, med speciellt intresse för systemövervakning.
   

  

 Vi har idag en väl fungerande övervakningsmiljö baserad på Icinga. I rollen som Teknikspecialist kommer du bland annat att axla rollen att ta övervakningen till nästa nivå tillsammans med dina kollegor.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Akademisk examen eller likvärdig kunskap förvärvat på annat sätt.
* Erfarenhet av drift och arbete med IT-infrastruktur i en större organisation.
* Goda kunskaper inom programmering i Python.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med övervakning av fysisk hårdvara.
* Goda kunskaper i Icinga och Icingastacken.
* Goda kunskaper i Linux och Linuxdrift.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga övervakning för tjänster.
* Kunskaper om API.
* Vana att sätta upp och felsöka distribuerade system.


*Det är meriterande om du även har:*
* Kunskaper inom SNMP (nät).
* Erfarenhet av arbete med VMware-övervakning.
* Erfarenhet av arbetete med övervakning av Windows-servrar.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med OpenManage Enterprise för hårdvara.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med HP Insight för storage.


*Personliga egenskaper:*
 Som person är du en riktig teamspelare som tar stort eget ansvar för ditt och teamets arbete. Med tanke på rollens karaktär är det viktigt att du är säkerhetsmedveten, ansvarsfull och noggrann.
   

  

 Du kommer även att ha många kontaktytor och därför är det viktigt att du har en god kommunikativ förmåga, både i tal och skrift på såväl svenska som engelska, har en god samarbetsförmåga och är flexibel.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Om oss**
 IT-avdelningen har ett övergripande ansvar att erbjuda användarvänliga, ändamålsenliga och stabila IT-tjänster till universitetets olika verksamhetsdelar. Vi är cirka 110 medarbetare som sitter i öppna lokaler centralt på campus i Frescati med goda kommunikationer. Vi erbjuder en härlig arbetsmiljö, spännande teknik och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet har över 5 700 anställda med 30 500 studenter och är rankat som ett av världens 200 främsta lärosäten. Ledande inom forskning och utbildning inom humanvetenskap och naturvetenskap, med en bred samverkan nationellt och internationellt. Universitetet har de senaste åren infört en portfölj- och produktstyrningsmodell där produktteamen har en central roll. Vi är i en lärande process och IT-avdelningen arbetar fokuserat för att följa modellen. Det innebär att vi testar, lär och utvärderar, hjälper varandra till framgång, levererar värde kontinuerligt och hjälps åt att skapa trygga förutsättningar. För att trivas hos oss är det viktigt att även du håller med om att det är rätt väg att gå.
   

  

 Hos oss finns ett stort engagemang, alla som arbetar här vill göra en insats. Du kan läsa mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag på vår hemsida.
   

  

**Anställningsvillkor**
 Anställningen avser heltid och gäller tills vidare med sex månaders provanställning. Stockholms universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning, ange därför gärna löneanspråk. Tillträde snarast.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en hybridlösning för distansarbete, friskvårdstid, friskvårdsbidrag, träningslokaler på arbetsplatsen, personlig utveckling och ett generöst semesteravtal.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Närmare information om anställningen lämnas av, gruppchef Liv Ando, liv.ando@su.se.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Ingrid Lander (Saco-S), tfn 0708-16 26 64, saco@saco.su.se, Alejandra Pizarro Carrasco (Fackförbundet ST/OFR), tfn 08-16 34 89, alejandra@st.su.se, samt seko@seko.su.se (SEKO).
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du söker anställningen via Stockholms universitets rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Bifoga endast personligt brev och CV. Kopior på betyg och intyg tar du med vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 Anvisningar för sökande finns på webbsidan: att söka en anställning.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Stockholms universitet bidrar till det hållbara demokratiska samhällets utveckling genom kunskap, upplysning och sanningssökande.

title: Solution Architect, Tietoevry Banking
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 The Tietoevry Custom Implementations business area is experiencing growth, and as a result, we are searching for additional colleagues who are interested in making a significant impact on the future of banking solutions for prominent Nordic players. We are currently in need of an experienced
 **solution architect** 
 , someone who possesses a wide range of knowledge in solution architecture and is capable of effectively leading architecture initiatives with development teams and engaging in productive conversations with clients.
   

  

**In the role of a solution architect, you will be responsible for:**
* Creating architecture and designs that prioritize quality and the long-term sustainability of solutions.
* Working on comprehensive assignments alongside motivated colleagues who share a strong commitment to delivering quality results, while also maintaining ongoing customer relationships.
* Collaborating with other architects as part of the architecture forum, which provides valuable opportunities for professional growth and the ability to shape technical decisions.
* Working at the forefront of technology, tackling transaction-heavy operations, addressing integration challenges, and participating in stimulating development projects with esteemed banking clients.


**What we are looking for:**
* Demonstrating a strong environmental awareness and an ability to identify opportunities through the application of new technologies.
* Possessing a background as a developer, which equips you with extensive knowledge of programming, system design, and system integration.


**Experience in the following areas is considered a plus:**
* Mini/micro services architecture.
* Utilizing Java and Groovy for enterprise services, leveraging well-known open-source libraries such as Apache Camel, Spring, Spring Boot, Apache Kafka, and more.
* Implementing CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Azure DevOps.
* Working with containerized runtime environments utilizing Kubernetes.
* Developing APIs based on OpenAPI specifications.


 As an individual, we believe that you thrive in collaborative customer-centric environments and enjoy working as part of a team. You possess drive, adaptability, and independence.
   

  

**In return, we offer you the following benefits:**
* Strength in Size: Being one of the leading IT companies in the Nordics, we provide you with more opportunities compared to similar organizations. Our extensive geographical presence in Sweden and worldwide brings a diverse range of customers, from small local businesses to large global enterprises - presenting you with a wealth of experiences and challenges.
* Continuous Development: Our broad scope of operations, coupled with our dynamic and fast-paced environment, supports your professional growth and development. We strive to remain at the forefront of industry trends and technology advancements.
* Modern and Inclusive Workplace: We are dedicated to creating a modern and attractive workplace. To foster innovation and skill development, we form workgroups that embrace diversity, harnessing unique perspectives and promoting collaboration.


 Overall, we aim to offer you ample opportunities for advancement, a supportive and progressive environment, and the chance to contribute to meaningful projects.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn profile and we’ll reach out to you.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact hiring manager Åsa Um, asa.um@tietoevry.com. Employment with us can mean placement in a security class. A security check with register control according to the Security Protection Act (2018: 585) may therefore be carried out before a decision on employment.
   

  

* We perform background checks on all final candidates.
* Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
* Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.


**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.

title: Ecommerce Sub Channel Manager
description:
Ecommerce Sub Channel Manager – “Focused Sales”
   

  

 Drive profitable growth Direct to Consumer
   

  

 At Electrolux, we are on a journey to provide our consumers with a simply outstanding experience across our business areas and through all channels where this role supports the evolving routes to market through D2C E-Commerce.
   

  

 We are now looking for an Ecommerce Sub Channel Manager to join the central E-Commerce team in Europe APAC-MEA. This Central D2C Ecommerce team’s core focus is to develop and leverage new routes to market delivering profitable growth for Electrolux.
   

  

 As Sub Channel Manager for “Focused Sales”, your mission will be to
 **commercially develop the channel cross markets and manage web shops for a selection of key markets** 
 in Business Area BA Europe APAC-MEA with the main objective to grow online sales for all our product categories. The role includes driving D2C sales in a local market (Commercial Area) and to be responsible for the Sub Channel “Focus Sales” cross the Business Area. The channel “Focus Sales” includes “Friends & Family”, “Staff Sales”, and “Corporate Programs”. It is an essential sales channel within our D2C offer.
   

  

 You will as Sub Channel Manager report to the Head of D2C Ecom Sales Execution & Support in BA Europe APAC-MEA and you will have one direct report. In the role you will make sure we
 **drive profitable growth** 
 across markets for the sub channel. Furthermore, you will manage sales execution responsibilities for a selection of markets cross ecom sub channels.
   

  

**In the position you will also:**
* Identify best practices and guidelines for the sub channel and structurally work to implement those cross markets together with the responsible Online Sales Managers.
* In collaboration with Product Team support in the requirement gathering and documentation process for commercial features. Includes training and communication to relevant stakeholders.
* Monitor and analyze local competitive landscape to adjust sales activities to local market conditions.
* Develop and execute the promotional campaign plans for assigned markets, ensuring alignment with other Electrolux channels and communication activities.
* Understand the mechanisms around SEO, SEM, email marketing, display ads and social media to drive traffic and generate demand.
* Monitor traffic, shopping behavior and other key metrics to optimize site performance and maximize conversion rate.
* Provide reports on weekly and monthly basis including analyses on campaign performance and main e-commerce KPIs that can explain current performance trends and suggest corrective actions.
* Collaborate with central and local sales, marketing, category management, supply chain and product line to maximize the impact in your area of responsibility.
* Actively work to enforce the D2C Ecommerce strategy.


**Qualifications**
* A bachelor/master degree in relevant field
* Minimum 5 years working commercially with D2C e-commerce
* Preferably experience from several ecommerce sales channels
* Good general technical understanding of a typical e-commerce environment
* Understanding SEO/SEM and other mechanisms that drive traffic
* Excellent Google Analytics skills
* Experience from working with SAP/ Hybris is a plus
* Fluent English is mandatory

title: Global Client Partner, Retail - STE 6-Month Contract
description:
Meta is seeking an experienced consultative sales and marketing professional to take on the role of global client partner. The Global Client Partner is the main point of global and regional contact for one of Meta's key retail industry partnerships. The ideal candidates will have Sales, Marketing, Consulting, Advertising and Media experience and have also demonstrated exceptional solid performance while working in a constantly changing environment. You will report to the head of retail and will be expected to travel International. You are used to c-level and senior management discussions.You will have extensive media knowledge and great communication skills, and the ability to consult and deliver high-end deals. This role entails developing a keen understanding of the client's business and organization, becoming a strategic partner and driving the relationship between Meta and the client at a global level. The Global Client Partner is the principal representative between Meta and their senior client leadership team, and at the center of an extensive internal (market teams & support teams) and external (agency & client) ecosystem of partners who are paramount to help them achieve their mission.
   

  

 Global Client Partner, Retail - STE 6-Month Contract Responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop thought leadership on client's business and industry
* Seek to understand Client's business objectives to ensure Facebook solutions are positioned appropriately
* Accountable for the construction of a plan or Joint Business Partnership to achieve these goals, and for delivering on service expectations as per Joint Business Partnership agreement, e.g. training, workshops, measurement studies, ultimately accountable for global revenue with that client
* Align with cross functional teams like Sales, Marketing, measurement, creative and solutions engineering to ensure client expectations are managed, and delivered upon
* Deliver the highest levels of client service by partnering with cross regional teams to align objectives, improve relationships and processes
* Set and communicate direction and prioritization of key markets and initiatives to support Client's Facebook activities locally, regionally and globally
* Collaborate with internal, cross market/regional teams to ensure product improvement, transfer knowledge region-to-region and improved process/client relationships
* Partner with Client's media and creative agencies to ensure synergies, collaboration and trusting relationships are established, towards a common goal of achieving Clients' business objectives
* Identify incremental revenue opportunities and scale accordingly and ensure Clients' investment targets are met or exceeded
* Monitor and provide timely and accurate forecasts of sales opportunities and pipelines


 Minimum Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven leadership ability to influence, develop, and empower colleagues to achieve objectives with a team approach
* Experience in managing multi-layer, complex business relationships
* Proven and consistent track record of executing against an aggressive growth strategy and contributing to client revenue growth rates above expectations
* Ability to convert business from other media channels
* Results and detail orientated
* Strong strategic thinking abilities
* Excellent leadership, organizational, and problem solving/decision making skills
* Motivated self-starter with strong interpersonal skills and strong work ethic
* Mastery of presentation skills
* Excels at building long term trusted relationships with C-suite executives
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 About Meta:
   

  

 Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

title: HR Business Partner Scania, Enabling Functions
description:
Do you want to be a key player in shaping the future role that HR is transforming into? At Scania the journey has already started with the launch of our global end-to end processes with supporting technology. You will have the benefit of belonging to a global company and at the same time working within an agile environment.
   

  

**If you are interested, now is the time to join us!**
**What We Can Offer You**
 In this role you will be a part of a big network of talented people to learn and share experiences with as we within the whole Enabling Functions are 30 P&C professionals dedicated to support our business who enable Scania to do better business and be the great company that it is today (Finance, P&C, Communication, IT and other Corporate Functions).
   

  

 As an HR Business Partner at Enabling Functions, you will play an important role together with your team to change the way we work and, work closely with the business to truly enhance our partnership and focus more on strategical questions. Your colleagues will consist of HR Business Partners as well as Specialist Roles. This gives us the opportunity to drive great initiatives within areas like competence & learning as well as talent & succession mgmt. You will take an active part in the team to explore new innovative solutions.
   

  

 We have flexible work where you can work both from home and at the office in Södertälje & Stockholm. You belong to an awesome HR team where cooperation is based on trust, joy, passion & commitment.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities as HR Business Partner** 
  

  

 As one of our HR Business Partners you share the HR responsibility of our HR processes with your colleagues. You work independently to support your assigned part of the organisation where you are a part of management teams on different levels. The role includes that you will be an advisory and strategic partner with the capability to proactively provide data into business decisions. Reaching excellent results in people management based on a data-driven approach.
   

  

  

* Be responsible for coaching the managers in the area of responsibility to get desired results from core HR processes
* Coach and challenge managers in their leadership
* Contribute to the creation of the people strategy to ensure that it meets business needs
* Balancing the long-term goals and the short-term operative HR issues
* Challenge and drive action when it comes to strategic workforce planning, organizational design (right size, shape, performance & dynamics), and performance management
* Bring data and analytics to the table. Put a price tag on challenges and get others involved through engaging communication (storytelling)
* Consult in change management.


**What We Expect From You**
 You have the ability to work in a consultative way which strongly contributes to managers need to drive the business. You have experience working with change management and is interested in leading change. As change is the main constant factor, both for our organization and our HR group, you appreciate working with high flexibility, customer focus, and a growth mindset.
   

  

 You have an analytical mindset and, you believe in the power of teamwork and curiosity. You have experience of qualified HR by working as an HR Business Partner or in a similar role.
   

  

 Your academic background is a university degree in HRM or equivalent. Learning comes naturally to you and using digital tools to enhance your productivity. You have good communication skills in English both oral and writing, Swedish is merited.
   

  

  

* Experience of working with HR processes, and understand the correlations between them
* Ability to work in a consultative way
* You believe in the power of teamwork and curiosity
* You have an academic university degree, preferably in HRM or equivalent.
* You are well versed with digital tools and use them to enhance productivity
* Learning comes natural to you


 Communicating in English and Swedish both oral and writing
 *Due to the vacation period, we will start handling the applications and answering questions from the 12th of August. From that week, we will have an ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the last application period, therfore the position may be filled before the end of the application period.*
*Please apply no later than 18th of August.*
*-Hybrid*
**Want to know more?**
 Reach out to;
   

  

 Katarina Ehngren, katarina.ehngren@scania.com
   

  

 Kristina Gauffin, kristina.gauffin@scania.com
   

  

 Mats Larsson, mats.larsson@scania.com

title: Global Head of GSI Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We have created a new senior leadership role, Head of Global System Integrator (GSI) Alliances, to lead our business development and partnership with these important actors in the global technology sector. As the publisher of Ubuntu and the leading provider of open source to major technology firms globally, we are expanding into the enterprise market where GSIs provide significant operational and tactical capacity. We have had good success with GSIs that are delivering next-generation private cloud, container, and public cloud solutions built with Canonical Ubuntu, and are looking to expand our investment in these alliances.
   

  

 Reporting to the VP Global Alliances and Channels, the Global Head of GSI Alliances will lead a team of representatives and develop that strategic go-to-market strength for Canonical. You will work closely with GSI partners throughout their sales cycles and across their sales organizations to make Canonical their trusted partner to deliver opensource solutions at scale for their enterprise customers. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring that our solutions are used or embedded at the core of GSI digital transformation platforms.
   

  

 Our GSI team builds trusted relationships with partners at executive level, increases Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelizes the partnership and leads all business interactions from engineers to CxO level. The Global Head of GSI Alliances will own the strategy, sell-to, sell-through and sell-with motions with all GSI partners, as well as promotion of our GSI related activities - from campaigns, to strategic opportunities and GSI related events (including Canonical s yearly GSI executive summit).
   

  

 Our company largely works from home, this role can be based in the Americas or EMEA.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Own and drive GSI partner strategy, forecast, bookings and revenues for Canonical
* Lead and evolve a team towards accelerated revenue growth with GSI
* Build strategic relationships with partners at executive levels
* Guide our offering from product management, to product marketing, and scale it through the support of our global sales organization


 What we are looking for in you:
   

  

 The successful GSI Alliance Sales Director will have :
   

  

* Experience in alliance and indirect sales management roles
* Experience in the GSI sector
* Deep commercial experience encompassing revenue and margins
* Proven leadership and presentation skills
* Insight into open source, Ubuntu and Canonical's competition and opportunities
* Track record of data-driven decision-making
* An autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentality


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert to Group Data Management
description:
**Job ID: 24435** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert for full-time employment agreement to continuously drive and support in securing high quality metadata capabilities, meeting the data governance needs of our stakeholders across the Group. 
 





  
 





**About our team** 






  
 





 Meet the Data Governance & Metadata Management (team name) team. Our role is to exercise a broad range of responsibilities including definition and maintenance of Group level policies and operating models, coordination, training and advisory, and metadata management to enable Nordea to take responsibility for, and gain value from data. 
 





  
 





 Our team is located in Group Business Support, Group Data Management and consists of experts in various fields of data governance where we all have a role as organizational change ambassadors, supporting the alignment and implementation of the DG Framework i.e. people, processes and technology coming to place in a good way. We are currently a team of approximately dozen experts and are looking to grow a bit. We have one or several employees in all the four Nordic countries and Poland
 





  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing** 






  
 





**Main responsibilities in this role:** 





* Identify, design, develop and implement efficient and effective metadata management processes and operational instructions that support to continuously maintain high meta data quality
* Engage in and develop training and knowledge sharing for practitioners using metadata services enabling them becoming a subject matter expert
* Hands-on support to the metadata owners and users by managing metadata in the services
* Develop and implement relevant monitoring and controlling processes to pursue implementation according to internal policies and relevant regulations
* As a member of DG&MM team you will also have opportunities to contribute and collaborate broadly across our area of responsibility



  
 





 The role is based in Helsinki, Gdynia, Gdansk or Stockholm.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





**This is the right role for you if:** 





* You are passionate about business meaning of data, understand metadata and its role in enabling world class financial services.
* You are a driver with positive energy, persistent with your goals, good in building effective networks and have shown your ability to act as interpreter between business and IT. You express opinions, and key points of an argument clearly to convey your message to different audiences.
* You are proactively proposing new ideas, approaches and insights and you continuously seek opportunities for organisational improvement.
* You are able to work independently while you’re a true team-player
* It would be perfect if you’ve worked with metadata in some context, particularly in financial industry, but we’re above all observing your eagerness to learn more and solid ability to communicate with a service-minded attitude
* You develop job knowledge and expertise through continuous professional development and have keen interest and ability on sharing knowledge with others



  
 





**Your background and skills include:** 





* Previous work experience in data governance and data quality, controlling/reporting and/or projects as e.g. senior analyst
* Experience in process documentation or process development and training others
* You have professional level fluency, both written and spoken, in English language. Proficiency in Nordic languages is a definite advantage
* While we prefer a university degree in technology or business, the full combination of you is that will matter the most





**It would be ideal if you also:** 





* Have experience with IBM InfoSphere Suite: Information Governance Catalog, Information Analyzer and/or Orion Governance: EIIG
* Well familiarized into using MS-Office tools



  
 





 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 





  
 





**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 





  
 





**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility. 
 





  
 





**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 





  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 16/08/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hannu Pertti Tapani Pitkänen.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
 





  
 





**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 






  
 





**We build relationships** 
 . We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 

  
 





**We learn and develop** 
 . We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges. 
 

  
 





**We lead change** 
 . We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy. 
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź.  We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Receptionsväktare Addici Stockholm
description:
**Stockholmsområdet**
 Addici Security & Technology söker
 **receptionsväktare** 
 till våra kunder i Stockholm för
 **deltidsanställning** 
 kväll- och dagtid. Vi erbjuder dig som medarbetare hos oss på Addici att vara med och forma morgondagens serviceleverans till våra kunder med fokus på säkerhet och trygghet. Du erbjuds även möjlighet att arbeta och utvecklas i ett innovativt företag med hög ambitionsnivå.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Receptionen skapar det första intrycket för besökare och ställer höga krav på service och bemötande. Som väktare i receptionen är du den första kontakten vid varje ärende, vilket innebär att du måste kunna prioritera efter behov och fatta snabba beslut. Vi bemannar receptionen under kvällar och helger, där dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar både traditionella receptionsuppgifter och säkerhetsfrågor. Arbetet innebär helg- och skiftarbete.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder internutbildning under betald arbetstid, och därefter kommer du att arbeta självständigt men med stöd och nära samarbete med dina kollegor.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen behöver du vara ansvarstagande, kunna fatta beslut och hantera stressiga situationer väl. Samarbetsförmåga med både kunder och kollegor är också viktigt.
   

  

**Exempel på dagliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Besökshantering
* Hantering av larm
* Ronderingar i fastigheten
* Vara spindeln i nätet vid säkerhetsrelaterade händelser


 Arbetet innebär kontakt med människor i olika situationer. Det är krävande, men också varierande, lärorikt och spännande. Du måste kunna hantera stress och trivas med att arbeta i grupp.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker en engagerad och social person som brinner för att hjälpa andra. Du är ansvarsfull, noggrann och bekväm med att använda dator och telefon som dina huvudsakliga arbetsverktyg. Både din svenska och engelska är mycket god i både tal och skrift, och vi ser gärna att du har tidigare datavana. Erfarenhet från serviceyrke är meriterande, men det viktigaste är din inställning och intresse för rollen.
   

  

 Vi fäster även stor vikt vid att du:
   

  

* Har fallenhet för att arbeta i flera tekniska system
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och en naturlig känsla för service
* Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp
* Har hög säkerhetsmedvetenhet, är drogfri och ostraffad


 Du kommer att ha mycket kontakt med både kollegor och leverantörer, vilket ställer höga krav på samarbetsvilja, stresstålighet och en positiv attityd. När tempot är högt är du flexibel och lösningsorienterad, samtidigt som du levererar service med säkerhet.
   

  

 För anställning krävs det att du uppfyller länsstyrelsens krav för anställning i ett auktoriserat bevakningsföretag. Du ska också vara ostraffad och ha en stabil ekonomi.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter och övrig information**
 Lön utgår enligt kollektivavtal mellan Säkerhetsföretagen och Svenska Transportarbetarförbundet.
   

  

 För mer information, kontakta Johan Blomberg via: Johan.Blomberg@addici.com.
   

  

 Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan annonsens utgång.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Om Addici Security & Technology** 
 Addici Security & Technology är en strategisk säkerhetspartner, ledande rådgivare och utförare inom riskhantering, bevakning, larmcentral, säkerhetsteknik och IT. Addici är en del av Coor och kan erbjuda säkerhet i kombination med facility managementtjänster. I partnerskap med våra kunder levererar vi lönsamma affärer – vi är kundernas trygga val. Bland våra kunder finns allt från små bolag till några av Sveriges mest komplexa anläggningar samt offentlig verksamhet. Med snart 40 års branschkunskap och över 800 anställda är vi redo att trygga våra kunders verksamhet, nu direkt och med morgondagens utmaningar.

title: Tech Lead with Machine Learning Expertise
description:
**About All Ears** 




 All Ears is a global leader in audio and new media monitoring, offering an AI-based SaaS solution that analyzes brands and trends in voice and video in real-time. Our superior coverage spans television, radio, podcasts, YouTube, and TikTok. With nearly 1000 customers across the Nordics, EU, and US, our clients include Walmart, Pfizer, Volvo, and KFC.
 



  





 Founded in 2016 with CTO Håkan Waara as a co-founder, All Ears is backed by investors like Bonnier Capital and Alfvén & Didrikson. Recently featured in “Deloitte Sweden Technology Fast 50 - 2023” and Breakit’s “Sweden's 35 most promising AI startups,” we have significantly strengthened our senior management and board of directors.
 



  





 In 2023, All Ears crossed the 40 million mark in ARR and has been profitable since January 2024, maintaining a solid cash position. We are now focusing on growth by enhancing our product and user experience, expanding into new languages and markets, and broadening our commercial approach. 🚀
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Tech Lead** 
 with extensive experience in
 **Machine Learning and/or Natural Language Processing** 
 to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal as it combines both technical development and leadership responsibilities. As the Tech Lead you will be playing a crucial role in scaling our tech team, managing complex technical projects, and driving the success of our tech development across multiple markets.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate closely with the CTO to set the technical vision and strategy for the company.
* Lead, mentor, and develop a team of software engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Use state of the art machine learning, NLP and AI to extract insights from our unique data.
* Oversee the implementation of NLP techniques to extract meaningful insights from our data.
* Work with data scientists and engineers to analyze and interpret complex data sets.
* Drive innovation in data analysis and AI, incorporating the latest industry advancements.
* Ensure best practices in data processing, model training, testing, and documentation.
* Drive the expansion of our tech team, including hiring, onboarding, and retaining top talent.
* Address and manage complex technical challenges as our company grows, including expanding into new markets and diversifying our product offerings.
* Work with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, and marketing, to align technical initiatives with business goals.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies, incorporating relevant advancements into our technology stack.
* Ensure best practices in software development, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.
* Report directly to the CTO and provide regular updates on project status, team performance, and technical challenges.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Deep knowledge of text analysis, NLP, Machine Learning
* Proven experience in a technical leadership role, preferably from a tech/product company.
* Strong background in software development, with proficiency in one or more programming languages
* Demonstrated experience in scaling tech teams and managing complex technical projects.
* Deep understanding of software architecture, cloud computing, and modern development practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound technical decisions in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Experience with agile methodologies and project management tools.
* Previous experience with audio and new media technologies is a plus.



  





**Meritorious Experience:** 



* Proven track record of scaling tech teams in terms of personnel and addressing more complex technical situations.
* LLM integration experience
* Experience with Python, React, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, distributed systems
* Experience in scaling and performance challenges



  





**Ready to join the team?** 




 Amazing! Apply by using your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions. We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so feel free to add a sentence about what you enjoy about your role and what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. Be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
 



  





*All Ears is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.* 




  





*Please note that we do not accept any applications through email due to GDPR.*

title: Backendutvecklare Produkt Tur
description:
Vill du vara med på resan mot världens bästa spelupplevelse? Vill du jobba med välkända produkter som Triss, Lotto och Eurojackpot? Kom till Svenska Spels IT-Turprodukter-team med ambitiösa och engagerade kollegor i en miljö som präglas av ny teknik och en stark uppfinnarkultur. Bli vår nästa backendutvecklare!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Din huvuduppgift kommer att bli backendutveckling med fokus på design och programmering. Du kommer arbeta i ett team som består av tech lead, systemutvecklare, utvecklingsnära testare och en teamcoach. Alla i teamet har till uppgift att skapa smarta, lättanvända, responsiva tjänster inom vår domän IT-Turprodukter. Teamet jobbar nära webbklientteamen som utvecklar våra Tur-produkter såsom Triss, Lotto och Eurojackpot.
   

  

 I din roll så kommer du att ansvara för såväl nyutveckling som förändringar av befintliga funktioner, och bidra till att skapa säkra, kundvänliga lösningar med mycket höga krav på prestanda. Vi jobbar i en inspirerande miljö där utvecklingsteamen har alla förutsättningar att kunna fokusera och vara effektiva. Att trivas på jobbet och ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid är viktigt för oss.
   

  

**Är du den som kommer att göra det?**
 Om du gillar att arbeta i team och är drivande, nyfiken, kundorienterad och har ett intresse av att utvecklas – både personligt och yrkesmässigt, kommer du att trivas hos oss.
   

  

 Vi Vill Att Du Har Minst Några Års Erfarenhet Inom Backendutveckling Och God Kunskap Om Utvecklingsmetodik. Du Är Van Att Jobba Agilt Och Har Framförallt Använt Dig Av
   

  

* C# microservices i molnmiljö (Azure/AWS/GCP)
* Continuous Deployment
* Kubernetes/Docker
* Eventdrivna applikationer (ex. Apache Kafka, Rabbit MQ)
* Enhetstester och integrationstester med ex. SpecFlow


 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från, Ruby, PostgreSql, MongoDB, REST-tjänster och RESTful-design. Deploy med Github Actions och Octopus Deploy. Samt fördel med erfarenhet av Asp.net och Entity Framework.
   

  

 Även erfarenhet av monitorering ex. opentelemetry, grafana är en merit.
   

  

**Om Tech på Svenska Spel**
 På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.
   

  

**Vi är Svenska Spel**
 Svenska Spel är hela Sveriges spelbolag. Vi skapar hållbara och roliga spelupplevelser som bidrar till ett bättre Sverige. Genom spel som Triss, Stryktipset och Oddset ger vi våra fyra miljoner kunder spänning, glädje och drömmar. Våra spel är enkla och trygga och oavsett om man spelar online eller fysiskt, själv eller tillsammans med andra, så ska upplevelsen alltid vara positiv. Vi vill att fler ska spela hållbart hos oss och vår verksamhet ska bedrivas på ett socialt, ekonomiskt och miljömässigt ansvarsfullt sätt. Varje år går överskottet till statskassan. Vi är Sveriges största idrottssponsor och investerar nära 300 miljoner kronor årligen i svensk idrott. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör samt skapar resultat tillsammans.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här:
   

  

 https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/formaner
   

  

  

  

**A** 
**nsökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering på något av våra kontor i Visby eller Solna med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete. Hela teamet sitter i Visby så det är förstås en fördel om du också gör det.
   

  

 Vi utför urval och intervjuer löpande så tveka in med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Mats Båge, Chef IT-produkter Tur, mats.bage@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se

title: Sourcing Manager
description:
**ValueOne is looking for an experienced and result driven Sourcing Manager Product Development with excellent knowledge in end-to-end Supply Chain for a consultant assignment at a manufacturing company in Stockholm. The assignment must be filled as soon as possible and will transition to permanent employment after completion of the assignment.** 




  





***ValueOne***
*are specialists in supply chain management, purchasing and logistics. We offer our customers services in three business areas: interim logistics and procurement consultants, recruitment of buyers and logisticians, as well as development of our customers’ supply chain operations in terms of strategies, models, methods, processes, structure, and competence.*
