title: Senior Scrum Master
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Scrum Master och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Säkra att teamet följer agila principer, processer och metoder.
   

  

 Facilitera de agila momenten.
   

  

 Undanröja hinder.
   

  

 Representera teamet i Scrum of scrums.
   

  

 Säkerställa att realisationen av kraven fungerar väl med våra lösningar i så väl befintliga som framtida miljöer.
   

  

 Aktiv bidra till att teamet som helhet ökar sin förmåga genom att
   

  

 Säkerställa att hen breddar sin egen kompetens genom kompetensöverföring från övriga teammedlemmarnas på samma sätt som hen ser till att överföra av den egna kompetensen till andra teammedlemmar.
   

  

 Föreslå och aktiv delta i teamutvecklande aktiviteter.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av agila metoder


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete på myndighet, eller annan större offentlig organisation.
* Erfarenhet av kravanalys


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 09-07-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: SaaS Integrator Engineer to SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**About The Role**
 As a SaaS Integrator Engineer, your mission is to onboard and coordinate new SaaS implementations in alignment with SEB’s SaaS First Directive. Here’s what you’ll help SEB to achieve:
   

  

* Accelerate SaaS Adoption: Enable secure and trusted integrations between SEB and third-party SaaS providers.
* Streamline Implementation: Support technical onboarding, and enhance, and maintain Golden Paths to enable scalability.
* Mitigate Risks: Support sourcing of new SaaS with standardizing requirements, capabilities, and processes.


**Your Key Responsibilities, but not limited to:**
* Work in a small expert team and cross-functional with the main purpose of onboard new SaaS Initiatives using existing and developing new tools like SaaS-specific non-functional requirements and RASCI.
* Coordinate technical capabilities e.g. Customer Managed Key (CMK), Single Sign-on (SSO) implementations, and actively support alignment with SEB’s strategies, guidelines, directives, and policies.
* Advise SaaS Initiatives early on during third-party evaluations.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Several years in cloud engineering or relevant experience (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Stakeholder management & project delivery experience
* Structured, organized, and focused on delivering business value.
* Problem-solving mindset and naturally a curious mind.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.


**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than the 30th of June. If you have questions about the position, please contact Rasmus Hallberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se
   

  

 Apply now and help shape SEB's cloud future!
   

  

 SEB Podcasts
   

  

 Listen to our podcasts about working at SEB and how the bank strives to drive change.
   

  

 Help us create change
   

  

**Data Engineer:** 
 https://open.spotify.com/episode/70IiBhmUYToxVjNaCN27rS?si=d5c895e56fd1433c

title: Innovative Developers to Scania I-Talent 2024!
description:
For the eighth time, Scania is starting its highly regarded I-Talent Program! This program is designed for those with a strong drive to develop, who are eager to contribute new ideas, and who want to be part of the effort to drive the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry! If you are graduating in 2024 or have a maximum of a couple of years of experience in your IT career, this is for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Scania CV Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Södertälje/Hybrid
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Their mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing a safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries and together with partners and customers they are driving the transition towards a more sustainable transport industry and are both trend setters and pioneers in electrification and sustainable transport systems.
 


  


 Together with several other I-talents, you will be offered a unique chance to participate in a program that will kick-start your journey at Scania. You are employed in a specific role and belong to a team but alternate the work in your role with meetings together with the other I-talents. The program starts every fall and is designed for you who are new in your career and aim to give you the best possible conditions to grow into your role. I-talent Program consists, in addition to daily work in your team, mainly of three parts - "Learning your professional role", "Go-and-see" and "Training". This provides very good opportunities to build a good network within Scania and in addition to your I-talents colleagues and your closest manager, you will be assigned a buddy who will be there for you the first time. At Scania, you are offered a multicultural work environment with ambitious colleagues and a company that invests in leadership. There is room for everyone to grow here, regardless of whether you want to be a generalist, specialist, or a leader. If you have the right attitude and are motivated to take responsibility, you will have all chances to develop!
 


  


  

**CI-Machine**
  

 As part of this team, you will belong to Scania R&D and be welcomed into an experienced, competent, and forward-thinking team that works with the CI-Machine – a new functionality that will be crucial for Scania's ambition to be a market leader in innovative solutions. The goal of the CI-Machine is to create an automated pipeline – an "integration-as-a-service solution" that enables designers to build, configure, and trigger tests for both software and hardware within the entire Scania modular system. Here, you will work with cutting-edge CI/CD development and operate fullstack with JAVA, Python, and AWS cloud. Your work will ultimately contribute to shorter lead times in production, improved environmental impact, and cost efficiency within Scania as well as Traton Group.
 


  


 Today, the team consists of 10 people, but there are great ambitions to grow, and we are looking for several i-Talents to join this team. You will be welcomed into a multicultural group from all over the world that enjoys each others company both on and off the job. The team works in a hybrid model between the office in Södertälje and remotely from home.
   




**We are looking for**
  
* A post-secondary education in computer science, electronics, mechatronics, network engineering etc.
  
* Knowledge or experience in Java, python or other programing language
  
* Knowledge or interest in testing
  
* Very good knowledge in English as it´s the primary language you will use in your daily work
  
* Highlt meritative with Swedish language proficiency
  


  

  

****The recruitment process****
  

  
* Phone interview with Academic Work
  
* Tests (problem solving + personality)
  
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
  
* Interview with Scania
  
* References + decision
  


  


  

**Additional information**



  

  
* Start: 1st september 2024
  
* Full-time, fixed-term employment for 6 months with a good chance of extension
  
* Location: Södertälje, with the possibility of remote work a few days a week
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work. Main recruiter, Emelie Säfbom, emelie.safbom@academicwork.se
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 Read more about the program!
   




**Get directly recruited to Scania CV Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emelie Säfbom or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stn05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105425

title: Ingenjör med förvaltningsuppdrag till MT Anestesi och IVA
description:
*Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är ett av Europas största universitetssjukhus med cirka 15 000*
*medarbetare. Sjukhuset är ledande inom den medicinska utvecklingen i Sverige och internationellt och vi* 
*rankas bland världens främsta sjukhus.*
*Vårt arbete präglas av ett professionellt, utvecklande och verksamhetsinriktat angreppssätt som aktivt* 
*stödjer Karolinskas strategier och mål samt bidrar till utvecklingen av Karolinska utifrån sjukhusets* 
*värderingar; ansvar, helhetssyn och medmänsklighet.*
**Du erbjuds**
 Vill du vara med och driva utvecklingen vid ett av Europas främsta universitetssjukhus? Verksamhetsområdet Medicinsk Teknik (MT) har ett uppdrag att säkerställa att Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets vårdverksamheter har den medicintekniska utrustning som krävs för att ge vård i världsklass, idag och imorgon.
   

  

 Verksamhetsområdet MT ansvarar för service, underhåll och förvaltning av sjukhusets medicintekniska utrustning och deltar aktivt i planeringen av framtida investeringar. Dessutom bidrar vi till att möjliggöra utveckling och innovation inom specialiserad och högspecialiserad sjukvård och accelerera användningen av ny teknologi för att lösa vårdens utmaningar. MT är organiserad under den centrala staben Teknik. Vi är ca 110 medarbetare med fyra utrustningsorienterade enheter och en enhet för projektledning och verksamhetsutveckling. Vår verksamhet är främst förlagd till Karolinska i Huddinge och Solna.
   

  

 Vår arbetsmiljö präglas av våra värderingar: Ansvar - Medmänsklighet - Helhetssyn
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset får du även ta del av de förmåner som vi erbjuder.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset skulle inte kunna vara ett världsklass universitetssjukhus utan en tekniksida som levererar hög kvalitet och effektivitet.
   

  

 MT Anestesi & IVA hanterar avancerade tekniklösningar som används brett över hela sjukhuset såsom patientmonitoreringssystem, infusionssystem och utrustning för andningsvård (ventilatorer). Enhetens målsättning är att säkerställa effektiv och ändamålsenlig hantering av den medicintekniska utrustningsparken genom hela livscykeln. Detta uppnås i förvaltningsdelen genom att utifrån vårdens behov av medicinsk teknik initiera och delta i upphandlingar, utarbeta strategier för tillhandahållande av utrustning till vården, säkerställa underhåll och hög tillgänglighet av utrustning, samt långsiktigt arbeta med livscykelhantering av utrustning. Arbetet genomförs i nära samarbete med leverantörer vilket medför att avtalshantering och leverantörsrelationer är en viktig del av arbetet. Du kommer att ha ansvar för en eller flera utrustningsgrupper. Det dagliga arbetet planeras och rapporteras till Förvaltningsledaren för MT Anestesi & IVA, medan personalärenden så som lön och ledigheter hanteras via enhetschefen.
   

  

 Förvaltningsdelen inom MT Anestesi & IVA består idag av totalt fyra medarbetare som har antingen klinisk eller teknisk bakgrund. Att ha en väl fungerande multidisciplinär grupp är mycket viktigt för att kunna möta vårdens behov av teknik. Nu behöver vi förstärka teamet med ytterligare en medicinteknisk förvaltare.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter som ingår i rollen
   

  

* Säkerställa att vårdens behov av medicinsk teknik tydliggörs och möts inom ditt delområde.
* Driva/leda investeringsprocessen för inköp av utrustningar som avser nyinvesteringar, kompletteringar och ersättning av utrustning inom ditt delområde.
* Självständigt ta fram och utveckla strategier i form av tex handlingsplaner, utvecklingsplaner och prioriteringar för ditt delområde så att Karolinska kan maximera vårdkvalitet på ett kostnadseffektivt sätt.
* Driva projekt och förändringsarbete för ditt delområde.
* Representera Karolinska i frågor med leverantörer som rör avtalsförhandlingar, avvikelser, utveckling och förändringar.
* Delta och medverka vid upphandlingar gällande kravspecifikation och utvärdering av leverantörernas anbud.
* Ta emot eskaleringar från kollegor som arbetar med service och support och/eller vårdverksamheter.
* Hantera avvikelser relaterade till ditt delområde.
* Tätt samarbete med service och support inom enheten men även inköp, Upphandling och IT.


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har ett engagemang och förståelse för hur teknikutvecklingen kan skapa nya och förbättrade förutsättningar för patienter och vårdpersonal.
* Är kommunikativ och lyhörd inför andras behov, känner av, lyssnar in och förmedlar information tydligt och rakt, justerat till mottagaren.
* Har en förmåga att förstå komplexa matrisorganisationer med många intressenter. Du räds inte för att ifrågasätta och lyfta nya perspektiv.
* Är en person som tar ansvar, egna initiativ och har en stark yrkesstolthet. Du kommer själv vara med och utveckla ditt delområde och styra hur din arbetsdag ser ut. För att följa med i förändringarna som sker inom vården är det av högsta vikt att du har en positiv inställning till förändring och omställning.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och kommer kunna erbjuda ett arbete med stor flexibilitet, frihet och eget ansvar.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
*Krav:*
* Akademisk utbildning teknik, vård eller annat relevant område
* Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med medicinteknisk mjukvara och/eller arbete i gränslandet teknik/vård
* Erfarenhet av projektledning eller annan samordnande roll
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga, svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


*Meriterande:*
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med/leda IT-installationer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med sjukhusövergripande system
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av MT-utrustning
* Erfarenhet av ekonomisk uppföljning och planering
* Erfarenhet av att förhandla med leverantörer
* Erfarenhet av nära arbete med vårdverksamhet


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval kommer att ske fortlöpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, vänta därför inte med din ansökan!
   

  

 Då det är semesterperiod kommer frågor om tjänsten kunna besvaras innan den 5 juli alternativt efter den 5 augusti.
   

  

**För att din ansökan ska vara komplett ska den innehålla:**
* Personligt brev
* CV


*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!*
 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Läs mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska här.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Serviceingenjör
description:
**Serviceingenjör inom Fastighetsautomation och energioptimering till Smart Infrastructure**
 Låt ditt tekniska intresse bidra till en hållbar värld; Create a better #TomorrowWithUs.
   

  

 Affärsområdet Smart Infrastructure på Siemens erbjuder integrerade, digitala och effektiva systemlösningar och tjänster inom fastighetsautomation, brand, säkerhet och energihantering i fastigheter.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en ny kollega som kommer att jobba mot ett av våra viktigaste objekt i Stockholmsområdet där komplexiteten är hög och där anläggningen alltid behöver vara i drift. Du kommer jobba i ett tajt team där du tillsammans med dina kollegor arbetar nära kunden med syfte att säkerställa en så drift- och energieffektiv anläggning som möjligt.
   

  

**Hur ser uppdraget ut?**
 I rollen som serviceingenjör arbetar du nära kunden och får en nyckelroll i att jobba rådgivande och proaktivt. Du lyssnar in och förstår kundens behov och kan samtidigt bidra med en expertis som skapar lösningar som löpande bidrar till en mer effektiv och smart anläggning. Som serviceingenjör blir du en nyckelspelare och ambassadör som förväntas ha en djupare förståelse för styrsystemets syfte och potential. Du levererar värde till kund genom dialog och ditt genuina intresse att göra skillnad. Det innebär att du även jobbar aktivt med att kontinuerligt utveckla samarbetet med kunden och att utveckla deras anläggning genom att föreslå förbättringar och förändringar.
   

  

 Du kommer över tid att bli expert på våra produkter, system och serviceerbjudanden för att jobba rådgivande med kund och kunna rekommendera nya tekniska lösningar för att utveckla deras anläggning. Du kommer att spela en betydande roll i vårt team, där du tillsammans med andra tekniker, projektledare, säljare och support, arbetar för att utveckla och underhålla relationen med kund.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett team av 15 tekniker som alla jobbar med projekt och service av fastighetsautomationssystem i Stockholmsregionen. Teamet präglas av att alltid vilja leverera bästa värde till kund och värnar om att tillsammans hjälpas åt för att nå sina mål.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi letar efter en person som trivs med att ta ansvar och som värdesätter nära relationer med kunder. Du brinner för att erbjuda en utmärkt service och att stödja kundernas tekniska utveckling. Din förmåga att organisera och prioritera uppgifter är stark, och du strävar efter att skapa en positiv arbetsmiljö där samarbete och ömsesidigt stöd är nyckeln till framgång.
   

  

 Du trivs med en närvarande ledare vars filosofi är att varje medarbetare ska synas och ha möjlighet att påverka. Mångfald är en nyckel till vår framgång, och vi välkomnar olika perspektiv och erfarenheter. Vi ser också personlig och professionell utveckling som en central del av vårt arbete – vi strävar alltid efter att förbättras tillsammans.
   

  

**Bakgrund**
* Du har ett intresse för teknik, gillar att utvecklas och är lösningsorienterad
* Du besitter erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa styrsystem inklusive överordnade system.
* Du har hög kunskap inom IT och nätverk och är van att jobba i servermiljö.
* Du har troligen minst 3-5 års tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknik inom fastighetsautomation och styr & regler.
* Körkort och ett svenskt medborgarskap behövs i tjänsten likaså att du kan kommunicera på svenska och engelska.


 Om du inte uppfyller allt ovan, men en del, uppmuntrar vi dig att söka tjänsten ändå. Låt oss tillsammans ta reda på hur vi passar ihop! Viktigast är ditt tekniska intresse, din entreprenörsanda och din inställning att sätta kunden först samt en nyfikenhet på digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 På Siemens arbetar vi varje dag för att göra skillnad för oss själva, våra kunder och vår planet. Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö där du har hög grad av frihet och eget ansvar över din arbetsdag. Denna flexibilitet ger dig möjlighet att upprätthålla en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Tjänsten är placerad i Solna och självklart erbjuder vi förmåner såsom friskvårdspaket, möjlighet till arbetstidsförkortning och tjänstebil. Som anställd på Siemens finns också mycket goda möjligheter att utvecklas, att axla nya roller och ansvarsområden och att lära sig ny teknik.
   

  

 Tveka inte - ansök idag! Rekrytering och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen som är 19 Augusti.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten kontaktar du rekryterande chef Matilda Stendahl på tel. +46 708 719132 alt matilda.stendahl@siemens.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta stefan.kristoffersson.ext@siemens.com.
   

  

 För kontakt med facklig representant maila Facket.se@siemens.com
   

  

**Om Siemens**
 Siemens är ett fokuserat teknikföretag som banar väg för intelligenta lösningar som omvandlar den dagliga tillverkningen, elnät, byggnader och transporter. Vår teknik tar itu med verkliga problem som påverkar mänsklighetens framtid: klimatförändringar, säker energiförsörjning, urbanisering och en åldrande befolkning. Med samarbete med mer än 300 000 människor och närvaro i mer än 190 länder har vi en verkligt global inverkan. Vi bygger en bättre framtid för städer, samhällen och industrier för att förändra livet för miljarder människor till det bättre. Vi har ett högt uppsatt hållbarhetsmål, att bli klimatneutrala till 2030. Läs mer och bli en del av vår familj: www.siemens.com
   

  

 Matilda med personal önskar dig välkommen in med din ansökan!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What we do** 


 At Centi, we believe in the power of ownership. Companies that give employees, board members and other stakeholders the opportunity to be owners create better outcomes for individuals, businesses and society as a whole.
 





 That said, setting up and managing ownership is often messy, time-consuming and rarely secure. This is what we are changing. We are building the leading equity management platform that enables businesses to manage equity ownership and engage their employees. We are still in the first innings of a long game, and we are looking for talented people to join us in our mission to create better outcomes for all. Our goal is to take the friction out of ownership and make it, well, just… work.
 




  




**How we work** 


 Centi was founded on the belief of a flat organisational structure; where decisions are made by those closest to the task at hand, each team member is empowered to drive projects from start to finish, and collaboration is integral to every step of the process. As an intentionally small team of 7, distributed between Amsterdam and Stockholm, we believe in passion, trust and autonomy to make Centi greater than the sum of its parts. We strive for simple solutions, fast iterative processes, and choosing the right people, partners and frameworks to enable us to build industry leading products.
 





 We are building a team of experienced individuals who can pick any problem and resolve it. Our ideal candidate is a passionate problem solver with a doer mindset who is able to drive feature development end-to-end.
 





 With Typescript as our first language we build modern scalable applications using frameworks such as Next.js, Inngest and TRPC. While we don’t expect you to have experience in all the platforms and frameworks we use, we do expect a solid understanding of Typescript, React and Node.js.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Build new user-facing features for our web applications together with our Product & Design team, from concept to deployment
* Collaborate with other engineers on improving overall system architecture and data model
* Implement solid analytics, monitoring and alerts
* Add documentation and automated testing where appropriate
* Work closely with our security partners to build secure web applications and handle sensitive financial data
* Contribute to the continued development of Centi as an organisation



  




**Our tech stack** 
* Typescript first monorepo driven by Turborepo, hosted on Github
* Fullstack applications with Next.js, TRPC, Inngest and Prisma, hosted on Vercel
* MySQL databases hosted on PlanetScale
* AWS (S3, Lambda, Cloudfront, SSM)
* Sentry and BetterStack for error tracking and monitoring
* Slack, Linear and Notion as our main collaboration tools



  




**What we offer** 
* Interesting and challenging work
* Startup environment with good work-life balance
* Competitive salary and equity
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Flexible working hours and location



  






 If you find this role interesting, we'd love to hear from you! Kindly send your CV along with a brief introduction to people@gocenti.com.
 




  





*Centi is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Presales Networking
description:
****Position:****
 Presales Networking
   

  

****Job Description:****
 As a Product Specialist, you will join the team of our successful networking team who are working from Kista with our IT partners and always focusing on "Customer First, Customer Last". In your role you will be working with primarily Juniper exiting portfolio and also touching on HPE and HPE Aruba, as they are becoming the winning team for the future.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing at Arrow?**
* Close contact with supplier and partners to enable growth and development.
* Develop strategic framework to build and enhance business relationship with supplier.
* Develop, grow and leverage the influential supplier relationships to negotiate competitive pricing and availability, to increase sales and gross profit for all regions.
* As the primary point of contact between partner and supplier, Product Specialists also arrange meetings via webcast, phone, or in person in order to drive and increase our market share.
* Arranges webinars enabling and develop the partners offerings with the suppliers solutions.
* Specialized in the suppliers Network & Security and able to discuss both sales and technology with both partner and supplier.
* Keep abreast of market & new technology development.
* Onboarded into suppliers provided systems for sizing, configuration and quoting to be able to help partners with offerings.


**What Are We Looking For?**
* Fluency in English and Swedish is a must to be successful in this role.
* Previous experience working within the IT networking area.
* You are passionate about the IT industry and you are particularly interested in future technology solutions.
* Ability and wish to acquire new skills and develop quickly.
* You are a good team player.
* University degree.
* Travel within Sweden, visiting partners and attending sales meetings.
* We are looking for the right mindset and a doer focusing on our partners.
* A plus is Juniper and HPE networking products knowledge.
* Strong aptitude for sales and solution-oriented thinking.
* Be able to drive the business incl internally administration.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage technical and non-technical audiences.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with partners.
* Flexibility to adapt to changing travel schedules and ad hoc needs.


**What is in it For You?**
* Possibility to work with various Security and Networking technologies and chance to get training in certifications in specific areas.
* Chance to work in a very friendly team of IT professionals in a global organization.
* Nice office location in Kista with the possibility to work some time remotely.
* Full-time contract.
* Opportunities for career growth and professional development in a dynamic team environment.
* Enjoy a successful team with a winning mentality.


**Our story**
 We are an American Fortune 500 company headquartered in Centennial, Colorado. Arrow's enterprise computing solutions (ECS) business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to the world's leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets. Please read more about us http://ecs.arrow.com/
   

  

**Arrow is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse working environment by providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons.**
****Location:****
 SE-Kista, Sweden (Kronborgsgränd)
   

  

****Time Type:****
 Full time
   

  

****Job Category:****
 Sales

title: Test Coordinator to Siemens Mobility
description:
Testkoordinator till Siemens Mobility
   

  

*På Siemens arbetar vi mot visionen om en hållbar värld som vi stolt kan lämna över till nästa generation. Vi gör det genom att utveckla teknik inriktad mot att lösa framtidens globala utmaningar. För oss är detta mer än ett jobb, det är vår delade passion och drivkraft.*
*Vill du också vara en del av vår resa och vara med och bidra till en hållbar värld?*
**Om rollen**
 Som Testkoordinator för Siemens Mobility kommer du att stödja införandet av ny programvara för planerings- och Trafikledningssystem. I denna roll kommer du att utveckla professionella testplaner för faserna innan och efter release, inom både interna och kundens miljö. Genom att samarbeta med kunder och kollegor, kommer du att skapa praktiska testsituationer och analysera resultaten därefter. Dessutom kommer du att verka i en internationell miljö, fungera som en nyckelperson för automatisering av testsituationer och manuella tester.
   

  

**För att lyckas i denna position behöver du ha:**
* djup förståelse för struktur och funktion av programvara.
* haft initial erfarenhet av att skapa testplaner och skriva testfall, eller ha motivation att lära dig dessa färdigheter.
* kvalifikation eller ha genomfört utbildning som IT-specialist, ha en examen i datavetenskap eller ett relaterat område med fokus på informationsteknologi och/eller järnvägsindustri
* starka kommunikationsfärdigheter och uppskatta att se bortom de omedelbara uppgifterna.
* Professionell kunskap (flytande) i både tal och skrift i svenska
* Professionell kunskap i engelska.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Inkluderande kultur där du välkomnas att vara dig själv.
* Vi uppmuntrar nya perspektiv och modet att tänka annorlunda och bryta ny mark.
* Flexibla arbetsformer för att uppmuntra en balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* Globala karriärmöjligheter.


 Vill du skapa en bättre morgondag tillsammans med oss? Ansök redan idag, vi intervjuar löpande. Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan. För frågor om rollen, kontakta Annica Gustafsson, Rekryterande chef på annica.gustafsson@siemens.com och för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta stefan.kristoffersson.ext@siemens.com.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Siemens Mobility har varit en ledare inom transportlösningar i mer än 160 år. Som en ledare inom transportlösningar formar vi uppkopplad mobilitet. Läs mer om Siemens Mobility: Hem - Siemens Mobility Sweden.
   

  

 Siemens är ett fokuserat teknikföretag som banar väg för intelligenta lösningar som omvandlar vardagen inom tillverkning, nätverk, byggnader och transport. Vår teknologi adresserar verkliga problem som påverkar mänsklighetens framtid: klimatförändringar, säker kraft, urbanisering och en åldrande befolkning. Med samlade krafter från mer än 300,000 personer och närvaro i över 190 länder, gör vi en verkligt global inverkan. Tillsammans med våra kunder och som en del av ett bredare ekosystem, skapar vi djärva och meningsfulla innovationer som förändrar sättet vi alla lever, arbetar, skapar och rör oss på.

title: Transport Hardware Specialist
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 Einride is seeking a dynamic Transport Hardware Specialist to take charge of a targeted sales territory. In this role, you'll be responsible for developing, servicing, and maintaining new and existing accounts for our range of new and used trailers, as well as other cutting-edge products within the trucking industry.
   

  

 As a Transport Hardware Specialist, you will develop, service, and maintain both new and existing accounts, ensuring strong customer relationships and satisfaction. You'll leverage your knowledge of heavy-duty transportation equipment to drive sales and meet performance targets. Overseeing the configuration and deployment of new and used tractors, trailers, and bodies for rigid trucks will be a key part of your role, ensuring seamless customer experiences. You will coordinate all aspects of the deployment process to guarantee that our customers are fully satisfied with their Einride experience.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Create and maintain Einride standard truck and trailer specification, as well as set customized specification for special orders (both trailer and bodies)
* Identify potential suppliers together with Procurement and develop relationships with vendors for lead recognition
* With Product Manager, develop deployment initiatives (goals). Review and update initiatives with sales management on a recurring basis
* Work closely with the Solution development team and Sales team to understand our customers' needs and requirements on transportation, and translate those into orders
* Identify and profile target accounts and execute a plan to develop them as a customer/partner
* Review Einride sales pipeline to create forecast for standard products for suppliers
* Research all customers as to their buying habits, their specific needs, pricing criterion and potential forecast on non-standard needs
* Support Operation and Deployment team with delivery and start up of new products


 As part of your job tasks, you will confirm with the Solution Development, Operation, and Deployment teams that the specifications are correct before placing an order. You will provide these teams with technical knowledge on suitable and cost-effective transport solutions, identify synergies between customer cases in a region, and participate in site visits when needed. Additionally, you will ensure support is in place for products in operation, develop supporting processes, and stay updated on new technologies, product advancements, specifications, and industry changes. You'll perform supplier and factory visits as necessary, manage and track all orders, coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, manage and track fleet and inventory, and attend and participate in European trade shows.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Experience of tractor-trailer, as well as different body solutions for rigids
* Extensive experience of sales configuration
* Knowledge in European road regulations in regards to heavy duty transport
* Excellent communications skills
* Strong coordination and organizational abilities
* Fluent in English


 This position is based in Stockholm. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 During July and August response time will be longer and processes will to some extent be on hold for a few weeks due to vacation season in Sweden. You can expect for us to get back to you on your application in August.
   

  

 Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Datacenter Lead Nordic
description:
*At Siemens we are always looking for world-class leaders who inspires others with a bold mindset and brings out the best in our people. By combining the real and the digital world- we build a better future for cities, societies, and industries to change the lives of billions of people for the better.*
 We believe that technology provides the solutions for the greatest challenges of our time. Technology is made by
 **people** 
 – it's up to us to lead the change and create an impact. This is how we give innovation a meaning and this is
 **#TechnologyWithPurpose.**
**Are you ready for an opportunity of a lifetime?**
 Join us to make a significant impact and help shape the future of sustainable infrastructure in the Data Center industry. As
 **Datacenter Lead Nordic** 
 at Siemens Smart Infrastructure (SI), you will spearhead the development and implementation of a sustainable cross-business Data Center Vertical Market Strategy. Your mission is to drive profit, growth, and satisfaction for customers and employees in this vertical. This role can be based in any of the Nordic countries.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Deep understanding of the Data Centre vertical landscape, including customers and competitors.
* Strong network at senior levels within the industry.
* Customer-centric mindset with a proven track record of building strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Adaptive leadership style to engage with teams and stakeholders, fostering a culture of trust and belonging.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and strong English communication skills.


**Your Success Factors**
* Deep understanding of the Data Centre vertical landscape, including customers and competitors.
* Strong network at senior levels within the industry.
* Customer-centric mindset with a proven track record of building strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Adaptive leadership style to engage with teams and stakeholders, fostering a culture of trust and belonging.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and strong English communication skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Leadership: experience from leading and developing a business and/or teams, with strong negotiation and influencing skills.
* Experience: 5+ years from Data Center industry. Additional experience from Siemens or similar Building Technologies or Power Distribution portfolios would be an advantage.
* Sales Management experience to ensure and lead the Data Vertical to achieve sustainable financial results
* Project Management experience to lead, manage and oversee complex technical projects.
* Market insight: Over 5 years identifying vertical market opportunities and commercializing solutions.


**We offer**
 Join us for an exciting and dynamic career filled with professional challenges in a supportive environment, as well as career opportunities within an international corporation. Enjoy competitive salary packages, good pension plans, insurance coverage and welfare benefits. You can also experience a diverse array of tasks across our numerous disciplines and business sectors, ensuring a stimulating and varied work experience
 **#TeamSiemens.**
 We offer a dynamic work environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a significant impact within the data center industry.
   

  

**Create a better tomorrow with us**
 We are looking forward to receiving your online application latest by 30th of August. We will be evaluating applications continuously, however due to summer vacation, please do not expect any feedback or updates on further process until mid-August at the earliest. For questions about the recruitment process please contact Lene Hoem Angelsen,
   

  

 lene-hoem.angelsen@siemens.com,Talent Acquisition Partner.
   

  

**About Siemens**
 Siemens is a focused technology company, pioneering intelligent solutions that transform the everyday in manufacturing, grids, buildings, and transportation. Our technology addresses real problems that affect the future of humanity:
 **climate change, secure power, urbanization and an aging population.** 
 With the joint forces of more than 300,000 people and presence in more than 190 countries, we make a truly global impact. Together with our customers and as part of a wider ecosystem, we create bold and meaningful innovations that change the way we all live, work, make and move.
   

  

 Siemens is a proud equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where innovation thrives, and employees prosper. Our commitment to diversity allows us to fully unleash the potential of our people. As part of our ownership culture, Siemens supports flexible working practices that empower our employees to balance work and personal commitments effectively. Read more about
 **Siemens**

title: Account Manager Global Connect Group
description:
**Job Description**
**Family Description**
 Sales (SA) covers end-to-end sales to customers and advocates customer intimacy. Comprises selling of products, services and solutions, and building and maintaining relationships with customers and potential customers. Contains management of customers, partners, and accounts while focusing either on a specific target group, specific products, services, solutions, or a territory.Note: population would be under the sales incentive plan.
   

  

**Subfamily Description**
 Account & Cust. Relatnshp Mgmt-CSP (RMC) comprises the creation and development of profitable relations with customers (incl. multi-geographic customer businesses) or new businesses through direct customer interface for a profiled customer base by implementing a strategy for a specified customer account, products, services, or solutions. Contains management of customer interactions and driving of sales for Nokia's offering. Covers creation of sales channels to grow new businesses in completely new prospects / markets and / or existing accounts targeting new revenue streams. Contains conduction of end-to-end business management (sales and delivery) for all customers and opportunities within the responsible scope.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accountable for managing the Global Connect account across multiple countries for the NI portfolio with an overarching sales target.
* Identify and cultivate new business opportunities, collaborating closely with pre-sales experts.
* Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders at Global Connect to understand their objectives and challenges, thereby increasing effectiveness.
* Coordinate activities among sales, pre-sales, and other functions to meet business objectives, leveraging organizational understanding and market knowledge.
* Participate in pricing strategies, contract negotiations, and contribute to the 'Win the Deal' process.
* Interpret internal and external challenges, recommending best practices to enhance products, processes, and services.
* Contribute to strategic decisions within defined scope, providing leadership and expertise to deal teams.
* Lead cross-functional deal teams with manageable risks and resource requirements.


 Key interfaces:
   

  

* Customer (CxO, Procurement)
* Head of NI Sales Nordics&Baltics, LG
* Business Group (Pre-sales, Pricing, F&C, Delivery)
* Legal and other Corporate Functions
* Strategy & Sales Ops


 Your skills and experience:
   

  

* Bachelor's or master’s degree in engineering, telecommunications, business, or related field.
* Approximately 10 years of relevant experience with a proven track record in direct sales within the Telecommunication/IT & related services industry.
* Excellent understanding of the local market/industry dynamics, including competitor trends, with specific knowledge of IP, Optics, and Fixed Access Networks solutions.
* Fluency in English; proficiency in any Scandinavian language (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) is advantageous.
* Strong technical background and understanding of Nokia’s complete portfolio on IP, Optics, and Fixed Access Networks solutions.
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and close deals, with a solid performance history of meeting or exceeding targets.
* Experience working within a matrix organization and effective communication skills across all levels.


**Required Skills**
**Impact**
 Impact is primarily short term and and typically functional, departmental or small single geographic in scope through management of resources. Accountable for departmenta/program goals, achievement and cost performance. Actions and errors will normally impact business, program, project, function. Marked contribution to defining the direction for new products, processes, standards or operational plans based upon business strategy.
   

  

**Scope & Contribution**
 Individual Contributor: Independently carrying out consulting, specific functional work within a Business Unit/Geography. Assumes broad perspective. Resolves unique and highly complex problems within own discipline. Makes decisions about own and/or project work using known solutions as basis. Managerial/Supervisory: Typically second (occasionally first) level of solid line management. Effective management of resources and development/implementation of plans and processes. Interprets policies and establishes procedures. Increased awareness and influence of other functions outside of own business area. Decision making often repeated in similar manner - able to choose correct solution or modify existing solution.
   

  

**Innovation**
 Highly independent and self directed. Develops plans, measures effectiveness. Assesses customer relationships and service levels. Can develop and implement complex and innovative concepts. Problems require searching and selecting. Anticipates problems, seeks opportunities. Models creative and innovative work methods.
   

  

**Communication**
 Communicates with parties within and outside of own job function, which may include external customers or vendors depending upon the job function.Requires ability to influence others outside of own job area on policies, practices and procedures. Has cross-cultural knowledge and global mindset. Works to influence others to accept job function’s view/practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices, and approaches. Requires influencing others outside of own job area on policies, practices and procedures, e.g. by expressing complex information in an engaging and inspiring manner.
   

  

**Knowledge & Experience**
 Management Experience / Mastery of a specific professional discipline combining deep knowledge of theory and practice within a function. Expert in more than one area, broad perspective. Typically requires 7-10 years extensive relevant experience and/or a graduate / postgraduate equivalent degree.
   

  

**About Us**
**Come create the technology that helps the world act together**
 Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
   

  

 We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work
   

  

**What we offer**
 Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
   

  

**Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer**
 Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
   

  

* One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
* Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
* Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


 At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   

  

 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Python developer to FCP
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Financial Crime Prevention is a vital aspect not just for SEB as an institution but for society at large. We’re dedicated to stopping fraud, preventing money laundering, and identifying any other form of financial crime. If you’re passionate about crafting solutions that aim at detecting, preventing, and reporting criminal activity, we invite you to read on!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Python developer in the Financial Instrument Surveillance team, you’ll embark on an innovative journey in software development. The team is developing and maintaining systems to conduct market surveillance detecting any sort of manipulation of the financial market as well as prevent rogue trading activities.
   

  

 Your mission as a Python developer will be to assure quality and efficiency in our delivery both with new solutions and maintaining what we have following our overarching strategy and goals to effectively stop financial crime.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Experienced and devoted Python developer, knowledge in Java is also good to have.
* A professional with a DevSecOps mindset and versatility in technical approaches.
* Experience with GitHub Actions or equivalent CI/CD tools.
* Familiarity with OpenShift, Docker, or Google Cloud will be an advantage.
* Experience from banking in general and financial markets and trading in particular is meriting.
* An analytical thinker capable of untangling complex technical challenges.
* You are open to change and thrive on new technologies and continuous improvement.
* A proactive team player who values collaboration and collective success.


**What We Offer**
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Interesting, innovative work
* Top-class client network and projects
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Opportunities to help transform an industry


*Learn more about working at SEB at* 
*www.sebgroup.com/career*
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in, or where they come from.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than the 30th of June. If you have questions about the position, please contact the Team Manager, by mail at marcus.stenman@seb.se

title: Project Manager Dynamics 365 F&O
description:
**Project Manager - Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations** 




  





 Stockholm Malmø Gøteborg - It is a prerequisite that Swedish can be written and spoken at a professional level.
 



  





 One of the largest Microsoft Dynamics partners in Europe is setting up a business unit in Sweden and is currently seeking Dynamics consultants and project managers for their first project in the country.
 



  





 The company focuses on the process industry, having developed ISV solutions for Pharma, Life Science, Chemicals, and Food & Beverage on top of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations. They are firmly rooted in these industries and come with an extensive catalog of references.
 



  





 You will be part of the company from the beginning and can have significant influence in building and growing the business in Sweden, while also shaping the company culture alongside your colleagues.
 



  





 The company is already established in Sweden with other subsidiaries, ensuring that support functions are already in place for a smooth start-up. This also provides the opportunity to have colleagues and various social events from day one.
 



  





  





 The company is headquartered in Europe, is a member of the Inner Circle for Microsoft Business Applications and has won Partner of the Year for Western Europe. They have more than 670 Dynamics customers and over 650 Dynamics consultants.
 



  





**About the job:** 




 You will be involved from the start of the projects - From pre-sales to being part of the implementation team, where you will have significant influence on the solution.
 



  





 As a Project Manager, you will be a key figure in the project's development and implementation.
 



  





 Your role will involve close collaboration with the customer and other consultants on the project to create the best solutions. You will work alongside the best consultants in the industry within the process industry and be part of a team with high expertise.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 You are an experienced and visionary professional with a solid understanding of Microsoft Dynamics 365 - preferably within the process industry.
 



  





 With at least 5 years of experience as a ERP Project Manager, you have a strong background in implementing large IT solutions and are comfortable navigating complex projects.
 



  





 Your ability to work across cultures and build strong relationships will be key to success in this position.
 



  





**Want to hear more?** 




 If you are up for an informal chat about the job, feel free to contact Easter Hay Att. Kim Mikkelsen at phone +45 4122 0032 / kimi@easterhay.dk.

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
**Job Title:**
 Implementation Specialist
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), ad tech and martech. We are part of Merkle Worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.
   

  

 Our Swedish Data & Analytics team is now looking for an Implementation Specialist to join our journey and help us grow.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 As an Implementation Specialist, you will collaborate closely with our clients, providing personalized assistance in customizing Google Analytics to meet their specific requirements. Your expertise will extend to offering strategic guidance to clients on data collection and utilization. In addition, you will be responsible for creating comprehensive implementation instructions for our clients' developers and aiding them throughout the implementation process.
   

  

 On a daily basis, you will utilize your proficiency in Google Analytics, JavaScript, and Google Tag Manager to carry out your duties. It can also involve configuring A/B tests using Optimizely and conducting thorough quality assurance and testing procedures. Emphasizing an iterative approach, you will maintain continuous communication with clients, ensuring progress is made towards mutually defined objectives.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Degree, vocational education, or other training within computer and systems sciences or a similar relevant background.
* Minimum of one year’s working experience, preferably within the consulting industry.
* Genuine interest in, and good understanding of, JavaScript and digital analytics.
* Ability to plan your work well, enjoy the iterative process, and stick to deadlines.
* Team player (both at our clients and with Merkle colleagues) yet able to work on your own, when needed.
* Professional, communicative, and confident.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.


 Previous experience working with SQL, BigQuery, jQuery (and other JavaScript libraries), and working for a consulting firm is desirable. It is also a plus if you have worked with Firebase from Google.
   

  

**Some of the Perks We Offer:** 
  

  

* Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
* Possibility to work with multinational companies in several different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
* The flexibility and best of both worlds – to work from home and from the office.
* Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics, and globally, when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
* Continuous personal development.
* Working from an office by Skrapan in Södermalm, Stockholm, or in central Gothenburg.
* The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle is a part of.


  

  

**Additional Information:**
 Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Please send us your CV.
   

  

 The position is full-time with permanent employment and is located at our Stockholm or Gothenburg office. There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. The job ad will be removed after filling the position. We will begin the selection process, but due to summer and vacations, active selection will take place in August. We look forward to hearing from you! For questions, please contact:
   

  

 Maria K., Cederbrand, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner maria.cederbrand@dentsu.com.
   

  

  

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Regional Sales Manager
Backend Developer
description:
**The Company**
 Joining a growing company and development team can always be exciting due to the personal growth opportunities you’re exposed to in such an environment.
   

  

 The company have gained a strong reputation in the Dyanmics365 community by helping their clients reduce costs, control their data, and improve compliance. Since 2003, they’ve been creating financial process automation solutions built for those inside the Microsoft ecosystem using D365.
   

  

 Their product is regarded as the premiere Accounts Payable Automation solutions for D365 F&O, Business Central (BC), AX and NAV. This solution is what incentivized a venture capital firm to invest in the company a few years ago before ultimately going through a public offer with a bigger VC/PE firm in 2023.
   

  

 Although based in Sweden, this investment activity has led to the company investing heavily into international expansion and broadening their sales and deliverability capabilities inside identified key markets such as the Netherlands, the UK, the USA, Canada, the rest of the Nordics, Australia, Malaysia, Singapore, and now Germany.
   

  

**The Role**
 Sustained demand for their solution globally means that you would join as a critical hire, bringing your expertise to the team to streamline development and collaborate across key stakeholders to ensure the core platform continues to impact customers.
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to implement your technical expertise to ensure the applications aren’t just up to date but continue to integrate the best offerings from Microsoft and the broader technology you’ve learned.
   

  

 The team is a dynamic and close-knit function of 8, supporting an application that is used by 90% of users, and you’ll enable their user satisfaction to remain high, and ensure systems continue the rollout of enhancements made possible by colleagues focusing on ML.
   

  

 A driven and open mindset is critical and will allow you to understand the business context and decide on the best technology practices to bring, and how it allows your colleagues to be successful.
   

  

**Role Requirements**
* Hands-on experience with .NET 7 or higher using C#.
* Exposure to Microsoft Azure.
* Experience working in agile and SCRUM environments.
* English and Swedish speaking and writing skills

title: Global Product Manager
description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
   

  

 That's our story. Make it your story.
   

  

 Your role and responsibilities
   

  

 Lorentzen & Wettre is a unit within Process Automation. We are the global market leader in quality testing and process measurement instruments for the Pulp and Paper industry. We are developing, designing and manufacturing instruments and serving our world-wide customers from our facilities in Kista, Sweden.
   

  

 Our customers are pulp and paper producers all over the world and we are regarded as a partner for them for more than 100 years. Our products include advanced measurement technology, mechanical and electrical design as well as embedded and internet connected software.
   

  

 We are a small organization of around 80 employees in Kista which allows us to act as a highly committed team focused on the importance of our business. In addition, we have 80 employees working with our product lines in markets around the world. We have a global focus and a market leading position in our niche, with five product lines in our portfolio and a global product manager responsible for the success of each of these product lines.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a business-oriented professional who is passionate about working with world-leading products in the pulp & paper industry. The portfolio includes process measurement and diagnostics instruments, used by OEM suppliers and end customers in paper mills. This role offers the chance to establish crucial customer relationships while taking ownership in shaping and enhancing the product portfolio.
   

  

* In this role you will have overall responsibility for the strategic success of the OEM product line, consisting of products built on microwave technology, with respect to financial and non-financial KPIs.
* Building customer relationships with our key OEM customers (10-15) with meetings at different levels and in different regions.
* Translating customer needs into product requirements and managing the portfolio to ensure customer satisfaction and long-term profitable growth of the portfolio.
* Developing the portfolio strategy by leading market analysis, understanding and defining current market segmentation, product positioning and identifying gaps in the portfolio (both against competition and new market opportunities).
* Leading life cycle management of the portfolio, defining pricing strategy, tracking product performance, planning appropriate measures and making decisions on product status to ensure that market requirements are met and to maximize profitability.
* Acting as an interface between external market and internal functions (e.g. sales, operations, R&D), providing support to our sales while collaborating with R&D in development of new features and functionality.
* Initiating and driving product market communication strategy including product launch and webinars. Defining product value proposition per segment and channel to ensure clear communication.
* Continuously and together with the product management team developing processes and tools. Initiating and sometimes leading product trainings and programs.
* Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.


**Qualifications For The Role**
* Engineering degree along with a genuine interest in business.
* 2-5 years’ work experience within market and sales from process industries, preferably Pulp & Paper, or experience from product business similar to ABB Lorentzen & Wettre.
* Highly driven and open-minded person with a team player attitude.
* Capable in or ready to learn Product Management skills and willing to grow with the role.
* Enjoy guiding, motivating and developing people in cross-functional teams.
* Willingness to travel.
* Fluent in English and Swedish, written and spoken alike. German language skills are qualifying.


 More about us
   

  

 Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.
   

  

 Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life balance.
   

  

 Recruiting Manager Per Sandström, +468 658 8148, or Team Lead Arsam Sahba, +46 722038761+ will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Jannica Åhman, +46 701 84 31 63; Ledarna: Kenneth Wahlqvist, +46 706 52 09 67; Unionen: Joakim Broström, +46 706 70 94 31. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46724612314. We look forward to receiving your application by August 11th. We conduct ongoing selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline. During the holiday period, response times may be delayed.
   

  

  

**91255009**
