* Manage the end-to-end release workflows and detailed steps to ensure on-time and effective delivery of high-quality releases
* Partner with key stakeholders to define release plans for upcoming release
* Be the interface between Product Management and Development during the release planning and roadmap definition processes.
* Work closely with development team(s) to resolve build problems/merge conflicts and to integrate the QA process with the overall CI/CD pipeline / Agile software development life cycle
* Work very closely with the CI/CD and Test team to increase the amount of automated testing done for each build
* Oversee pre and post release tasks to ensure adherence to quality control processes.


**Skills required:**  

* You can easily collaborate with others
* Proven leadership skills
* Excellent communicational skills
* Fluent in English both spoken and written
* Driven with a can-do attitude
* Highly organized, analytical
* Technically-curiosity and always eager to learn
* Minimum 5 years of work experience of Configuration management position dealing with agile development processes and continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD)
* Experience of both On-premise and Cloud-based product releases
* Familiar with modern development and release management tools such as Jira, Bitbucket, Github, Jenkins, Artifactory, DockerHub, Confluence
* Proven track record of managing multiple project deliverables in a fast-paced international environment
* Ability to assesses technical risk for complex issues and decide best course of action
* Ability to define and track success metrics

title: Application Consulting - SAP Finance
description:
**SAP FICO Consultant**
-----------------------

**At Capgemini, we are dedicated to helping businesses thrive by providing innovative solutions and expert consulting services. We are looking for highly skilled SAP Finance Consultants to join our team. If you are passionate about finance and have a strong background in SAP, we want to hear from you. At Capgemini you have the opportunity to influence your own knowledge development as you wish, it’s up to you – Get The Future You Want! In this role, you will belong to a great team with other SAP experts. Our office is placed at Kungsholmen, Stockholm, which you are welcome to how often you like.**  



**YOUR ROLE**

**As an SAP Finance Consultant at Capgemini, you will play a crucial role in advising and assisting our clients in leveraging SAP solutions to optimize their financial processes and achieve their business objectives. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, clients, and stakeholders to ensure successful SAP implementations and ongoing support.**  



***In this role, you will play a key role in:***

* **Analyzing clients' financial processes, identifying areas for improvement, and develop SAP solutions to address their specific needs.**
* **Configuring and customizing SAP Finance modules, including SAP FI (Financial Accounting), SAP CO (Controlling), and other relevant modules.**
* **Providing expertise and guidance on best practices for SAP Finance implementations and supporting clients in making informed decisions.**
* **Collaborating with project teams to ensure SAP solutions are integrated seamlessly with existing systems and business processes.**
* **Offering training and support to end-users to ensure a smooth transition to new SAP Finance solutions.**
* **You will run workshops for our customers, something you are already used to.**

**YOUR PROFILE**

* **Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.**
* **Proven experience as an SAP Finance Consultant, with a strong understanding of SAP FI, SAP CO, and other relevant modules.**
* **Experience from SAP S/4**
* **Proficiency in configuring and customizing SAP Finance solutions to meet clients' needs.**
* **Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.**
* **Leadership skills**
* **Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.**

**About Capgemini**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

**Get The Future You Want |** **www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Digital Kommunikatör
description:
Vill du vara med och fortsätta att befästa vår position som ledande varumärke och tillverkare inom Fritidsfordon i Norden samt en stark bidragsgivare till vår spännande tillväxtresa internationellt?
  
  

Vi söker nu dig som har bred kunskap inom kommunikation, digitala media och relaterad projektledning. Du är mycket kunnig och intresserad av digital marknadsföring, har hög prestationsnivå, är noggrann samt besitter den strategiska höjden, för att i rollen som Digital Kommunikatör, bidra till nya nivåer i vår marknadsföring och på våra plattformar.
  
  

ARBETSUPPGIF­­TER
  
* Skapande av engagerande och konverterande innehåll till sociala media, foto- och filmproduktion samt texter.
* Skapa kampanjer och annonser för Meta, programmatic och Google Ads. Uppföljning av statistik och optimering för bästa resultat.
* Produktion av tryckta annonser, vykort, vepor och liknande exponering.
* Kommunikation och samarbeten med återförsäljare, bolag i koncernen, externa partners, tidningar och press.
* Förbereda och deltaga på mässor och events.
* Produktion av katalog, strategiskt välja ut texter och layout för en premium produkt.


Marknadsavdelningens uppdrag är brett och omväxlande med ansvar för extern och intern kommunikation med fokus på KABE’s varumärke och alla våra kärnvärden. Du bidrar med innehåll till olika kanaler, för olika målgrupper och deltar i allt från utveckling av koncept och tonalitet till hands-on produktion. Du skapar rätt känsla både för print, video och digitalt, stöttar kollegor och värnar tydlighet. Du ser trender och har erfarenhet av att driva sociala medier kanaler, både organiskt innehåll och betalda kampanjer. På vår marknadsavdelning arbetar du tillsammans med kollegor ansvariga för innehåll som bild och video, formgivning, webb, sociala medier, evenemang, försäljning och mässor. Du tar gärna ansvar och projektleder marknadsföring kring mässor och event.
  
Våra målgrupper är nya såväl som mycket erfarna fritidsfordons-entusiaster i primärt Europa med en växande marknad internationellt. Då vi arbetar via Återförsäljare kommer du även ha en regelbunden kontakt med dessa och bidra till även deras kommunikation och digitala utveckling.
  
Vem söker vi?
  
Du är en generalist som gillar att arbeta flexibelt, praktiskt med strategi i åtanke. Du driver kampanjer i sociala medier lika enkelt som du skapar innehåll som sticker ut. Det faller sig naturligt för dig att parera flera projekt samtidigt och du stimuleras av att se ett resultat i arbetet. Vidare är du prestigelös som person och har en vilja att hjälpa andra då du blir en del av ett team. Slutligen är du noggrann och värdesätter att leverera ett arbete med god kvalité.
  
  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet från en liknande roll som Kommunikatör eller likvärdig roll där du skapat, producerat och publicerat innehåll i digitala och analoga kanaler
* Erfarenhet av att driva sociala medier kanaler organiskt samt betalda kampanjer
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av att arbeta i Adobe Creative Cloud InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Meta Buisness Suite, Google Ads, Youtube, LinkedIn, Office 365, Mailchimp, Canva, Program för att redigera kortare videos till sociala medier, Chat GPT eller liknande AI tjänst


Vad erbjuder vi?
  
Ett omväxlande och innovativt teamarbete i ett framgångsrikt företag med korta beslutsvägar. Vi värnar om en god arbetsmiljö med stimulerande arbetsuppgifter. Hos oss får du både den familjära stämningen och fördelarna med att ingå i en större koncern med kollegor och relationer både i Norden och internationellt.
  
  

För ytterligare information är du välkommen att kontakta Marknadschef Joakim Karlsson .
  
  

Välkommen att visa ditt intresse genom att skicka in ditt CV.
  
Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande.
  
  

KABE AB är den största och ledande nordiska tillverkaren av husvagnar och husbilar med egen utveckling, design och produktion belägen i Tenhult, 10 km utanför Jönköping. KABE tillverkar och säljer husvagnar och husbilar till den europeiska marknaden genom varumärkena KABE och Affinity. Försäljningen av KABEs produkter sker uteslutande via återförsäljare och KABE har idag över 100 fristående återförsäljare på de bearbetade marknaderna runt om i Europa. KABE har idag c: a 700 anställda och majoriteten har Tenhult som sin bas.
  
KABE AB ingår i KABE Group och har sedan starten 1957 ständigt utvecklats och är idag en internationell koncern med produktion i Sverige, Storbritannien och Polen och försäljning på 14 marknader i Europa. Totalt omsätter koncernen c: a 4 miljarder kronor (2023) och antalet anställda uppgår till drygt 1 000 personer. KABE Group AB är noterat på OMX Nordiska Börs, Stockholm, Nordiska Listan, Mid Cap.
  
Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

title: MARKNADSKOORDINATOR MED FOKUS PÅ COPY & SOCIALA MEDIER
description:
På SATS har vi som vision att inspirera fler till ett mer hälsosamt och lyckligt liv genom träning och vi söker nu en kommunikativ marknadskoordinator som vill bidra till vårt viktiga uppdrag och fortsatta varumärkesutveckling.
  
Ser du ett stavfel på mils avstånd, är strukturerad, har ett öga för detaljer och vill jobba brett med kommunikation som gör skillnad? Är du en content-nörd som gillar att bearbeta texter för att nå rätt målgrupp i olika kanaler och går igång när ditt senaste inlägg på Instagram slog rekord? Då kan det vara dig vi söker till vår marknadsavdelning i Stockholm. För att trivas i rollen behöver du även älska sociala medier och följa de senaste trenderna.
  
Om tjänsten
  
I rollen som marknadskoordinator för SATS Sverigekommer du att ha en bred roll på marknadsavdelningen och ansvara för att skapa innehåll till en rad olika kanaler, både online som offline. Att publicera i olika digitala kanaler, skriva artiklar om träning och hälsa och skapa engagerande innehåll till sociala medier blir en del av dina arbetsdagar.
  
Du kommer även att vara delaktig i att koordinera lokala events, beställa tryckmaterial, publicera pressmeddelanden och arbeta med HR i gemensamma CSR-initiativ. Du är en strukturerad projektledare med checklistor för det mesta och du trivs med att vara spindeln i nätet i många olika projekt. För att trivas i rollen behöver du gilla allt från att översätta färdiga texter till att kunna skapa initiativ själv från grunden.
  
Du rapporterar till marknadschefen i Sverige och blir en del av vårt svenska marknadsteam där du spelar en viktig roll. Du arbetar också nära vår nordiska inhouse-marknadsavdelning där vi har hög kreativitet, högt i tak och stort engagemang!
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Översätta, korrekturläsa och anpassa texter till den svenska marknaden.
  
Skapa engagerande texter till olika kommersiella behov.
  
Koordinera, planera och genomföra olika marknadsinsatser.
  
Publicera innehåll i olika digitala kanaler som på webb och i sociala medier.
  
Beställa CRM-utskick mot olika målgrupper i vår medlemsbas.
  
Stötta vid PR-events och lanseringar av nya gym.
  
Skriva pressreleaser och publicera på Mynewsdesk.
  
Ansvara för lokala CSR-projekt tillsammans med svenska HR-avdelningen.
  
Arbeta tätt med ansvarig för SEO och mäta resultat.
  
Och mycket, mycket mer!
  
  

Om dig
  
Vi tror att du är en lösningsorienterad och strukturerad kommunikatör med ett öga för detaljer och copy-hantverket. Du är en självgående do-er som tycker att det är roligt att utvecklas och utmanas i ditt arbete. Högst troligt har du också ett intresse för träning och hälsa, gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom området och blir motiverad av vår vision.
  
Du har en högskoleutbildning eller liknande inom marknadsföring/journalistik och har arbetat några år på en marknadsavdelning eller byrå. Du tycker att marknadsföring är bland det roligaste som finns och du gillar att hålla koll på det senaste inom sociala medier. Du är van vid att publicera i olika kanaler och att arbeta utifrån strategi som du delvis varit med att själv ta fram. Du är en begåvning när det kommer till det skrivna språket och kommer gärna med förslag på hur man bäst når ut i olika kanaler.
  
  

**Formella krav på din bakgrund:**  

Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom kommunikation och/eller marknadsföring med tonvikt mot copy eller journalistik.
  
2-3 års erfarenhet av arbete på en marknadsavdelning eller byrå.
  
Dokumenterat duktig skribent/copywriter.
  
Du kommunicerar obehindrat och flytande på svenska och engelska.
  
  

**Önskemål:**  

Kunskap och erfarenhet av att publicera i sociala kanaler.
  
Erfarenhet av SEO och Adobe-program.
  
Du rör dig vant genom olika system som Contentful och Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
  
  

Tjänsten är på heltid med sex månaders provanställning och med start omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.
  
  

Sista ansökningsdag är den 16 augusti 2024. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
  
Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
Be part of a team that is successfully implementing the most advanced and intelligent technologies for our customers. We are currently looking for an experienced
 **Service Delivery Manager** 
 to join our team in Sweden (Our Office is located in
 **Stockholm** 
 ).
 



  





 As our new
 **Service Delivery Manager** 
 , you will be at the forefront of implementing the most advanced technologies for our customers. Your mission is to ensure exceptional service delivery, meet financial targets, and create a sustainable work environment for your team.
 



  





 Within this role, your responsibilities and tasks will include:
 


* Establish the right environment and assembling the right team to deliver on client commitments and expectations.
* Ensure transparency and performance visibility to the client and to Roboyo leadership.
* Ensure engagement data is continuously and accurately being gathered and published to the relevant stakeholders.
* Monitor ticket dashboard and prioritizing tasks for service delivery team members to ensure SLAs are satisfied.
* Publish periodic reports to client stakeholders, other members of the engagement team, and Roboyo leadership and governance groups to provide full transparency into performance of the service objects under care and performance of the Roboyo managed services team.
* Ensure the lead engineer is consistently enforcing adherence to standards and best practices and has a complete quality assurance process in place.
* Ensure the service delivery team has access to required systems, tools, environments, and client experts to efficiently perform their work.
* Ensure the necessary environments, tools, pipelines, and test data are in place to properly test and deploy service objects into production.
* Ensure the service delivery team is frequently and consistently updating tickets with the latest information as they progress through diagnosis and resolution.
* Monitor the performance of service objects and the performance of the service delivery team to ensure service level commitments are satisfied.
* Ensure that clients receive services commensurate with their resource allocation every month, leveraging extra time on months where incidents or client-driven requests are low to provide proactive services where possible.
* Ensure all engagement members submit all timesheets every week, with at least 40 hours, and reflecting what engagements and items were worked on as accurately as they are able.
* Log into client systems for every engagement they are assigned to at least once every thirty days and quickly checking in on the service objects to ensure they stay up to date and keep their client accounts active.
* Handle exceptional conditions and collaborating with client stakeholders to resolve them successfully.
* Schedule review sessions business stakeholders and the Business Analyst to gather feedback and identify improvement opportunities.
* ​Coordinate with IT stakeholders and the Business Analyst to manage system changes and service updates.



  





  





**Requirements** 



* Relevant experience in technical service delivery and programming IT solutions, preferably with .NET, C#, VBA, Java, PowerShell or Python
* Relevant experience with automation technologies (Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, UiPath, etc.).
* Excellent communication skills and social competence for establishing and maintaining strong relationships with leadership, peers, direct reports and customers
* Team player attitude with willingness to learn new skills related to new automation and digitization topics, such as AI, low code, IDP
* Understanding of customer processes and willingness to bring forward improvement ideas
* Able to deal with challenging customer and staffing issues in a professional and supportive manner and to see these through to resolution
* Fluent in English and Swedish. Additional languages a plus


- 


  





  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary package
* 30 days paid vacation
* Recognition and reward for individual and team achievements
* Regular team events
* You’ll love coming to our cozy office to meet your colleagues
* Significant opportunities for skills development and career progression including individual development plan with career coaching
* Global mobility

title: Customer support and Implementation
description:
Mitigram is a Stockholm based trade finance platform with a global business. We all share an exciting vision to mobilize and establish ourselves at the heart of the trade finance community and ecosystem. Trade Finance itself is the part of banking that supports trillions of dollars’ worth of trade every year, facilitating business between buyers and sellers across the globe.
 




  






 Our platform provides a Marketplace connecting 1000s of banks and corporates for easy access to competitive financing and seamless digital transaction management. Our technology is built to enable trade, through finance - and connect with the ecosystem to drive sustainable growth of global trade and prosperity.
 




  






 The Mitigram team is highly diverse with members from 15+ countries from leading institutions in trade, investment, risk management, software, security, and compliance.
 




  





**The role & the team:** 





 As Custommer support and Implementation, you will work in the Services team to make sure that Mitigram's clients are on-boarded to our platform and supported throughout the day-to-day usage.
 




  






 You will work with experienced trade finance teams to understand client needs and convert that to needed configuration and customization on the Mitigram SaaS platform. You will also be a part of the daily support of clients' questions and issues creating long term customer satisfaction. Internally, you will collaborate with both our commercial team parts of our technical team to deliver the best experience for the customer. This hybrid position requires on-site work at our Stockholm office a minimum of three times a week.
 




  





**What you will do:** 




**System Implementation:** 



* Lead and manage system implementation projects from initiation to completion.
* Conduct needs analysis and collaborate with clients to understand their specific requirements.
* Configure and customize systems to meet client needs.
* Develop and deliver training sessions to end-users on system functionalities.
* Create comprehensive documentation for system configurations and client-specific customizations.



  





**Application Support:** 



* Provide frontline support to clients, addressing and resolving application issues promptly.
* Troubleshoot clients’ problems, identifying root causes and present resolutions.
* Escalate complex issues to higher-level support or development teams as necessary.
* Assist in the development of support documentation and FAQs for end-users.



  





**Continuous Improvement** 



* Stay current with industry trends to provide informed recommendations.
* Identify opportunities to improve internal processes and implement best practices.
* Participate in ongoing training and development opportunities to enhance personal and professional growth.



  





**What you should have to be successful in the role:** 



* An interest in financial software and trade finance.
* Minimum 2 years of prior experience from working with finance, support, or software.
* Experience/awareness/knowledge of technology solutions.
* A strong desire to understand and learn details of the trade finance area.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Strong organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.



  





**Great if you:** 



* Are familiar with project management methodologies and tools.
* Have experience from trade finance, treasury or similar.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Competitive remuneration
* A varied and challenging role in a highly multinational and innovative company
* Office in central Stockholm
* Development and further training opportunities for shaping and realizing your career goals.



  





**What happens next?** 




 If you feel this is the right position for you, don’t hesitate to apply today! If you are not completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, apply anyway as we value many other qualities as well. Interested candidates should submit a resume including a cover letter detailing their interest in the internship and relevant qualifications.
 



  





**Reference and background checks** 




 As part of the recruitment process, we will ask the final candidate for a couple of references that they have had or currently have a work-related relationship with in the last 5 years. We may also conduct a background check.
 



  





**About Mitigram** 




 Mitigram is one of the most exciting Fintech companies coming out of Europe. Strong growth, among the world’s largest corporates and banks as our clients, and leading investors ensure we have a lot of exciting challenges and opportunities for anyone that joins at this stage.
 



  





 In March 2020, Mitigram expanded into Asia. Using Singapore as a base, Mitigram plans to expand rapidly across all of Asia and Oceania.
 



  





 Mitigram has developed a world-leading online marketplace and end-to-end execution capabilities built for the trade finance community. Our product is recognized by thousands of individuals from Montevideo to Shanghai. We are the fastest growing trade finance network in the market, and we are looking for someone to help us drive our growth.
 



  
 



 For more information about our company and the exciting work we do, visit our website www.mitigram.com
 



  
 



 Start your career journey with Mitigram and make a significant impact in the world of trade finance! We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Area Lead Engineer – Integration Platforms
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you want to play an integral part in accelerating H&Ms digitalization journey? If your heart races at the thought of Engineering and Integration, and you are passionate about evaluating, developing and implementing innovative integration platforms and services then we've got an incredible opportunity waiting for you. As Area Lead Engineer at H&M Group, you will be responsible for four Engineering teams (API Platform, Event Platforms, Developer Portal and Integration Services) within the Integration Platforms & Services Unit. You will be partnering with other visionary teams to support our unit to drive the mission of empowering product teams to build sustainable and secure integration solutions for faster time to market.
   

  

 In your role you will be working closely with relevant stakeholders, you’ll dive deep into the organization's requirements and needs, offering critical insights that help our product managers and software engineers within the unit to maintain and develop new capabilities on the central platforms. You will lead the teams dedicated to operating and maintain central platforms such as API management service, Event platforms, API Developer Portal and integration services and tools but also to build enhancements and improvements on these platforms for engineers to utilize to be able to deliver business solutions. The area should deliver best-in-class engineering services that improves H&M’s speed to market, flexibility, and scalability by providing frictionless technology with self-service capabilities.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for API, event, and integration platforms in alignment with the organization’s goals and objectives.
* Ensure high availability, performance, and reliability of all managed platforms.
* Ensure simplified and efficient self-service capabilities of all managed platforms.
* Monitor and manage the financial impact of decisions and priorities of the product teams.
* Collaborate with other distributed product teams to deliver/consume new capabilities provided by the Integration Platforms & Services Unit.
* Develop strong relationships and work cross-functionally with many teams across organizations and functions, and as a result, deliver solid and future proof integration solutions that deliver business value.
* Lead and provide technical guidance to the teams.
* Mentor and coach, your team members to enable them to grow professionally and increase their performance.


**Qualifications**
 You'll be part of evaluating new technologies, ensuring they align with H&M's mission for product and service excellence. We're seeking someone with a forward-looking mindset who's not just ready for change, but who embraces it with enthusiasm and foresight. If this sounds like you, then let's embark on this exciting journey together at H&M Group.
   

  

**What you need to succeed:**
* Knowledge of API platforms (Azure API management, MuleSoft) and in-depth knowledge of how to maintain and operate them on a large scale in an Enterprise
* Knowledge of Event platforms (Solace PubSub+, Azure EventGrid, Kafka)
* Knowledge of API first strategy and Event-driven architecture and implementation of integration using APIs and Events
* 10+ years of software engineering work experience, including hands-on work with integration solutions such as API management platforms and Event platforms
* Minimum of 5+ years of product management with demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products.
* Demonstrated experience recruiting and managing technical teams, including performance management.
* Demonstrated experience in maintaining test and production environments.
* Deep understanding of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full-time position** 
 based at our office in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **04th of July 2024** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas.
   

  

 Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way.  Learn more about H&M here.

title: Network Admin
description:
* Desktop/Laptop Hardware related troubleshooting - Create, test and develop current Workstation images.
* Prepare and configured new laptops/workstations specifications as assigned.
* End User Computing (EUC) Device Refresh as part of BAU ( any bulk refresh will be treated as separate project activity)
* Works closely with vendors and managed services to maintain systems and services, manage change, and deploy new systems and services
* Provide onsite PC repair, virus- and spyware-remediation, maintenance/rejuvenation, data-recovery, networking and upgrades.
* Windows upgradations through SCCM agent.
* OS and application installation: Windows migrations and deployment of customized images using SCCM
* Troubleshoot for Windows and have good working knowledge of Office products; provide printer/fax support
* Knowledge of server and network communications equipment, protocols (i.e. DNS and TCPIP), transmission media, security and network management practices
* Analyzed and diagnosed DNS/DHCP/VPN and other networking issues
* End user issues related to network, IP config, windows troubleshooting
* Actively worked with hardware and software vendors to resolve client issues in a timely manner
* Active Directory, folder access and Group Policy administration, hardware configuration. User Support for VPN, MS Office, applications.
* Installation of printers, Configuring conference room facilities
* IP Phone installation, troubleshooting
* O365 configuration, troubleshooting
* Other aspects related to End user computing
* Deskside Support
* Spares management
* Installs, moves, adds, changes of hardware and software packages (IMAC);Hardware life cycle management
* Security compliance
* Populate Knowledge Management system with resolutions and workarounds
* Act as an escalation resource to the Help Desk, Site Administrators and Network Operations Center to assist with issues affecting endpoints
* Enterprise Mobility Management administration - enrollment and management of mobile devices. Adept knowledge on Airwatch – intelligent hub/MDM/ intune / azure
* Fault diagnosis / troubleshooting
* Maintain the Service Now queue of an average of 5-20 tickets per day, resolved Level 1-2 support issues
* Ensure swift ticket resolution and escalate issues to Level 3 technician as necessary



 Adept knowledge on Software Center(SWC) and ServiceNow

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we enable businesses to reach everyone in the world, through mobile messaging, email, voice, and video.
   

  

 We believe equal opportunities are the key to our success. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face captivating challenges, and build skills alongside outstanding people.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 Join our team at Sinch as a Senior Data Engineer, where you'll be responsible for constructing, maintaining, and supporting data pipelines across our global product portfolio. Apply innovative ways and cutting-edge technologies in the market to excel in this role. We're seeking a candidate with a proven background in SQL, Python, and ETL/ELT that takes a proactive approach to address intricate challenges and craft data pipelines that not only empower the data domain but also enhance connectivity within Sinch through the effective use of data.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and functions under a hybrid model, reporting to the Data Engineering Manager.
   

  

**As Our Senior Data Engineer, You Will**
 This role offers a distinctive chance for you to lead, drive, and implement impactful initiatives in a rapidly growing business. Our dedication to taking action is unwavering, acknowledging its importance not only for our esteemed customers but also for the greater global community.
   

  

* Lead data engineering projects, ensuring their successful delivery.
* Provide valuable support to leadership, serving as a technical authority for the team.
* Offer guidance to team members during code reviews to maintain high standards of quality.
* Promote best practices in data engineering within and beyond the team.
* Drive the data integration efforts across diverse platforms and products.
* Contribute to the development, performance, quality, monitoring, and maintenance of data pipelines.
* Identify areas for improvement in our products, business processes, and architecture through insightful data analysis.


****Who are you?****
 We believe you are a professional skilled in pipeline development and governance, with experience in tools for virtualization and a background in real-time data processing. Your organizational prowess is evident in breaking down projects efficiently, and your expertise extends to designing new data architectures with a focus on security standard processes. Your diverse skills make you a valuable asset, poised to drive innovative data solutions for our dynamic team and evolving business.
   

  

* Proficient in software development with expertise in Python, Spark, Git, CI/CD, and Docker.
* Skilled in using SQL for data querying and ETL/ELT development.
* Experience in structuring and storing large volumes of data in data lakes and warehouses.
* Capable of fixing and optimizing data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
* Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow, Dagster, and experience using Databricks.
* Cloud experience in AWS or GCP.
* Knowledgeable about various data architectures such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric.
* Strong communication skills with fluency in English for engaging with stakeholders from technical and business areas.


****Ready to chase your dreams?****
 Join our data-centric organization by submitting your application in English.
   

  

 Together, let's shape the future of data-driven innovation, where organizational data lies at the heart of what we do. Be a part of our global data team that promotes growth and embraces hybrid work arrangements.
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, adopt change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not able to support relocation outside EU at present, therefore, will take into consideration only applicants who hold a Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship, or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

title: Global Account Manager
description:
BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.
   

  

 What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?
   

  

 The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure's vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we've only scratched the surface of our ambitions.
   

  

 Pure is blazing trails and setting records:
   

  

* For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
* Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
* Industry analysts and press applaud Pure's leadership across these dimensions
* And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


 If you, like us, say "bring it on" to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...**
 Pure Storage is seeking a Global Account Manager (GAM) with proven ability to win and then lead a small subset of global accounts. The GAM will coordinate the strategy and team-selling efforts with partners and teammates to close business on a quarterly and annual basis. Proven ability to exceed assigned quota, prospect, close global contracts, and build new and deep relationships with large global customers is key. The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to develop long-term relationships with Channel Partners that drive revenue as well as relationships with customers from end users to the line of business to the CxO. Ability to drive satisfied and referenceable customers while maintaining an accurate forecast and working with multiple channel partners is critical. This is a new business
 ***,***
 hunter territory that requires experience and proven success opening large accounts.
   

  

* Prospecting: proven track record of penetrating accounts; reaching decision-makers and closing business.
* Direct strategic account planning and leadership of a global account team
* Establish and manage complex relationship network of 'C' level stakeholders and highest level senior internal representatives
* Assemble and work to a detailed strategic account plan designed to deliver value and meet the customer's business and IT objectives
* Coordinate different areas of the organisation to formulate go-to-market strategies for nominated global accounts
* Manage complex customer/ supplier / partner dynamics
* Assess customer, market trends and provide timely and accurate revenue forecasting
* Drive accelerated revenue growth by identifying potential markets for new and existing products and services in accounts
* Identify, pursue and close sales opportunities and leads
* Deliver the necessary input to ensure on-time delivery of high quality proposals for managed accounts and prospects as well cost of ownership illustrations and business value justifications
* Develop sales, business and relationship plan for accounts


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...**
* Deep understanding of the customer's business, it's market and industry alongside key decision-makers and influencers in account organization
* Ability to translate customer's objectives and strategy into relevant Pure proposition
* Ability to effectively communicate at all levels of an organisation, including the C-suite
* Liaise with Global Enterprise Senior Management as required for executive level sponsorship program
* Experience of working with major Nordics Global Accounts
* Experienced working with C Level (internal and customers)
* Strong decision-making skills – able to identify key business issues
* Strong communication skills – able to convey understanding and messaging in a clear, concise and compelling manner, both verbally and in writing.
* 7-10 yrs.+ successful global accounts/enterprise solution selling within technology services
* 7-10 yrs.+ Enterprise sales experience
* Ability to lead and manage an international and distributed team.
* Ability to think strategically and drive sales transformation programs
* Deep work experience in Telecommunications / IT Industry
* Enterprise Storage desirable
* Excellent communicator (Verbal, Written, Presentation)


 You will be based in Stockholm, Sweden. As this is an office-centric role, you are expected to be present in the office for 3 days a week. As outlined in Pure's Hybrid Work Policy, there will be variations over periods of time, depending on business need.
   

  

**BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.**
 Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
   

  

 Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
   

  

 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.
   

  

**PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.**
 Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.
   

  

 If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at
 **TA-Ops@purestorage.com** 
 .
   

  

**APPLICANT & CANDIDATE PERSONAL INFORMATION PRIVACY NOTICE.**
 If you're wondering how or why Pure collects or uses information you provide, we invite you to check out our
 **Applicant & Candidate Personal Information Protection Notice** 
 .

title: Chief Architect – Manager Enterprise Architecture, Solna
description:
We seek to strengthen our position and enhance our Enterprise Architecture capabilities within PostNord Group IT. We are looking for a Chief Architect – Manager Enterprise Architecture who will play a pivotal role in advancing PostNord’s business through effective Enterprise Architecture management. We offer you a dynamic and innovative environment, highly skilled colleagues, excellent benefits, and a fantastic office. Apply now to the Chief Architect role!
   

  

 As the Chief Architect – Manager Enterprise Architecture, you will be a part of our crucial Enterprise Architecture team. This team defines and oversees the Enterprise Architecture strategy, standards, and governance across the entire PostNord group organization. You will ensure IT solutions align with business goals and support PostNord’s transformation into a digital and data-driven business, positioning the company as a leader in the industry.
   

  

**PostNord**
 PostNord connects companies, authorities, and individuals through its unique network, facilitating business, trade, and communication across the Nordic region. In 2023, PostNord delivered 245 million parcels and 1.1 billion letters and other mail items. Formed by the merger of Post Danmark A/S and Posten AB in 2009, PostNord operates mainly in the Nordic region and is 40% owned by the Danish state and 60% by the Swedish state, with voting rights equally distributed. The group headquarters is in Solna, Sweden.
   

  

 After the merger, PostNord expanded into heavier logistics by acquiring companies in Norway and Denmark, making it the largest parcel company in the Nordic region. Employing around 135,000 people, PostNord is committed to sustainability, aiming for fossil-free operations by 2030, and plays a crucial role in Nordic society by fulfilling the universal service obligation (USO) in Sweden and Denmark.
   

  

**Enterprise Architecture Organization**
 PostNord’s Group IT unit, and specifically the Enterprise Architecture team, are central to strategy execution. The Enterprise Architecture team defines and oversees the Enterprise Architecture strategy, standards, and governance across the PostNord group organization, excluding subsidiaries. This team ensures IT solutions align with business goals and support PostNord’s transformation into a digital and data-driven business, positioning the company as a leader in the industry.
   

  

**Chief Architect – Manager Enterprise Architecture (EA)**
 The Chief Architect will drive PostNord’s business through effective Enterprise Architecture oversight. This involves defining and supervising the Enterprise Architecture strategy, standards, and governance processes across the entire PostNord group organization. The objective is to ensure that IT solutions align with business objectives and achieve strategic aims, propelling PostNord towards a unified Nordic IT landscape. Acting as the central hub, the Chief Architect will collaborate with various business and IT stakeholders, harnessing emerging technologies and best practices to enhance innovation and efficiency.
   

  

 Responsibilities will include directly overseeing the Enterprise Architecture team, guiding them in aligning IT solutions with business goals and executing strategic initiatives.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Define and oversee Enterprise Architecture strategy and standards across PostNord Group
* Lead a team of architects to align IT solutions with business goals
* Maintain the Enterprise Architecture vision, principles, and frameworks
* Drive the architecture towards a unified Nordic IT landscape
* Establish governance processes and standards for IT solution quality
* Promote the benefits of Enterprise Architecture to stakeholders
* Evaluate emerging technologies and best practices for feasibility
* Foster a culture of trust and continuous improvement within the team
* Handle hiring, onboarding, salary, budget, and reporting


**Your profile as a Chief Architect**
 As a Chief Architect, you are persistent, patient, and determined to achieve results. You exhibit strong leadership traits, being solution-oriented with a genuine interest in people and practicing transformational leadership. You possess the ability to make decisions and prioritize effectively. Inspirational and motivational, you adapt easily to lead, communicate, and collaborate with various teams and levels within the organization.
   

  

 You are a visionary who can see the bigger picture with a forward-thinking mindset. Your strategic, creative, and analytical problem-solving abilities are key to navigating complex challenges. You thrive in managing uncertainty in dynamic and change-driven environments, demonstrating strong stakeholder management skills with a Nordic leadership style.
   

  

 Social and easy-going, you are a natural relationship builder, capable of handling straightforward communication. Your approach fosters trust, empowerment, and continuous improvement within your team, ensuring alignment with business goals and driving PostNord towards a unified Nordic IT landscape.
   

  

**We Are Looking For You Who Have**
* Solid experience in IT architecture, design, and development
* Proven track record of leading and delivering complex and large-scale IT solutions.
* Broad experience and knowledge in multiple IT domains
* Understanding of both legacy systems and new digital concepts
* Experience in corporations with outsourced environments
* At least 5 years of experience in an Enterprise Architecture role
* International experience in the Nordic region


**Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**
* Experience with security and regulatory environments
* Experience from the business side
* Expertise in various IT methodologies, frameworks, and standards
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, information systems, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience


**Language Requirement**
 Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious
   

  

**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
* Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own employee foundation PostNord Plus
* Employment according to a collective agreement


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Click here to apply
   

  

 In this recruitment PostNord collaborates with D.match. If you have questions or want to know more, please reach out to:
   

  

**Daniel Naseri**
 daniel.naseri@dmatch.se
   

  

 +46 721 81 14 11
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden (Stockholm is an advantage)
   

  

**Reporting to: Frida Nellros, Head of Technology Acceleration**
 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Client Executive Enterprise
description:
Vår kund är en strategisk partner inom betallösningar och söker just nu en
 **Client Executive Enterprise!**
 Genom flexibla betalsätt, anpassade kundresor och långsiktiga partnerskap hjälper vår kund stora nordiska e-handlare och butiker att öka sin lönsamhet, skapa tillväxt och lyckas på sin marknad.
   

  

 Vår kund möjliggör för e-handlare att utveckla och öka sin affär!
   

  

 Vår kunds strävan är att bli det självklara valet för stora nordiska handlare genom att göra betalningar smartare, enklare och tryggare samt stärka relationen mellan handlare och slutkunder.
   

  

**ROLLEN**
 Försäljning mot Nordens största e-handlare och retailbolag.
   

  

 Målet är att ständigt följa, analysera och proaktivt hjälpa och stötta kunderna till framgång och högre försäljning/ROI.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du erbjuder innovativa betallösningar för e-handel, OMNI och detaljhandelskanaler.
   

  

 Ditt främsta ansvar är att bygga och utveckla din egen portfölj av handlare, säkerställa deras ökade försäljningsprestanda och kontinuerliga tillväxt.
   

  

**DIN ERFARENHET**
* Jobbat inom PAAS – Payment as a Service.
* Har arbetat med betallösningar och datadrivna, digitala köpresor.
* Erfarenhet från att ha jobbat hos retailkund dvs större nordisk E-handel eller retail så som tex NetOnNet, AWS, Nelly m.fl.
* Erfarenhet av försäljning inom e-handel och den digitala affären, försäljning och projektledning.
* Erfarenhet från cloud based payment management solutions.


**ERBJUDANDET TILL DIG**
 För oss är det självklart att varje individs utveckling värdesätts högt vilket innebär ett stort fokus på självledarskap och kompetensutveckling. Gemenskap, innovation och modern arbetsmetodik är saker som kännetecknar oss. Vi erbjuder dig helt enkelt en organisation med snabba beslutsvägar, stor öppenhet och mycket energi.
   

  

 Våra värdeord Affärsmässighet, Engagemang och Omtanke genomsyrar allt vi gör och som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av vår starka företagskultur. Vi erbjuder dig ett spännande bolag med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, löpande kompetensutveckling och gemensamma aktiviteter på och utanför arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar enligt en hybrid-setup med placering på vårt fina kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 På plats, vilket vi är några dagar i veckan, sitter våra team tillsammans vilket främja kommunikation och samarbete.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi självklart med Talent&Partner.
   

  

 Du är välkommen med Din ansökan snarast då urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande.
   

  

 Dina ansökningshandlingar ska innehålla CV och ett personligt brev gärna foto.
   

  

 Skicka din ansökan idag via work@talentpartner.se

title: Head of OEM Alliances
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Large OEM or Independent Hardware Vendor (IHV) brands - Dell, HPE, IBM, Lenovo, Ericsson, Cisco, Fujitsu and many more - are major partners for Canonical. These companies often build software-defined solutions which they take to market, and Ubuntu is a key ingredient in cloud-native and edge or IoT solutions. More and more of those solutions depend on open source. Canonical Ubuntu is the best platform for rapid open source innovation.
   

  

 The Global Lead OEM Alliances is responsible for IHV partner success - we want them to thrive and grow their business with Canonical software, solutions and services. This is a leadership role, responsible for strategic IHV Alliances worldwide.
   

  

 Reporting to the VP Global Alliances, our IHV Alliance Sales Director will work closely with strategic partners across their complex organizations to engage with their innovation teams and ensure that they consider and integrate Ubuntu stacks and solutions. For example, private clouds, container solutions, and vertical solutions for industries like telco and automotive, are increasingly built on open source and Ubuntu. We are the challenger platform, but we are growing quickly in the industry.
   

  

 The OEM Director is responsible to build trusted relationships with IHV partners, increase Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelize the partnership and lead all business interactions from engineer to CxO. He/she will often run customer workshops focused on particular initiatives at that customer, attend sales events, give public presentations and lead executive engagements.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role can be based remotely in the EMEA or Americas region
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Build strategic relationships with IHV partners at levels
* Grow their awareness of open source capabilities on Canonical Ubuntu
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of the Linux and cloud software ecosystem
* Negotiate contracts and commercial business terms
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of large and complex organizations
* Lead partnerships with global accounts such as IBM, Samsung, DellEMC, HPE, Nokia etc.
* Work closely with marketing, sales engineering and product management
* Deliver on targets, objectives and provide a voice of the partner
* Lead executive interlocks between IHV and Canonical leadership
* Travel regularly - sometimes internationally - to drive partnerships in person


**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience in alliance or indirect sales management roles
* Autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentality
* Ability to capture customer requirements, evaluate gaps, identify and create opportunities
* Passionate about Ubuntu products and mission
* Comfortable in fast-paced and high pressure environments with measurable goals
* Experience with Linux, virtualization, containers, and other cloud technologies.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Back-End Engineer (Remote or Stockholm)
description:
I'm currently working in partnership with one of Europe's fastest growing Fintech startups, headquartered in Stockholm!
 



  





 A leader in Open-Banking powered A2A payment software solutions, they are already present in over 25 financial markets, integrated with over 3500 banks across Europe, and their products reach 350 million people globally!
 



  





 Developing modern, Cloud-based solutions for payment initiation and authentication, their product line optimizes the entire financial transaction process, making for faster, smarter and more secure payments for both merchants and customers!
 



  





 Having grown consistently in recent years, they have a super talented engineering department, which they are looking to grow further with a senior backend engineer! This is a permanent position, and whilst they have a vibrant office in central Stockholm, they also have a super flexible remote policy allowing you to work fully remote across Sweden!
 



  





**Senior backend engineer:** 




  





 As a Senior Software Engineer, you will work with our core team of highly skilled developers. Your tasks will be to develop and build a scalable and future-proof framework. You will work on building components to bridge between us and the banks across Europe, in order to deliver authentication (AIS) and payment initiation (PIS). As a Developer, you will have a major impact on building the foundation of our core platform. With that said, you will be a vital part of the next fintech unicorn!
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* Strong experience in systems development in Python, with further experience in both Golang & Angular also being very valuable



  




* High competence within Google Cloud



  




* At least 4 years of developer work experience within modern, Microservice-based systems



  




* Swedish/EU Citizenship or permanent residency in Sweden - unable to support with Visa sponsorships or extension currently



  





**Meriting experience:** 




  




* AWS, Azure experience can also be beneficial
* Kubernetes
* Microservice architecture
* Experience working with Fintech and Payments



  





**Preferred skills:** 




  




* A degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* Experience from building scalable, service-oriented architectures
* Experience from working with transaction-intensive systems
* Experience with Docker
* Experience with Javascript/Typescript
* Experience with information security from a systems development perspective (OWASP, encryption, etc.)



  





**What we offer** 




  




* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards.
* A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
* An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
* A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigeless approach
* A yearly wellness allowance and Tuesday breakfasts at the office
* ... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people!

title: Territory Account Manager
description:
*Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplex teknisk försäljning till flyg- och försvarsindustrin? Vi söker en dynamisk Territory Account Manager till Wind River som ska driva tillväxt genom försäljning av unika och högteknologiska lösningar till flyg- och försvarsindustrin.* 




  





**OM WIND RIVER** 




 Wind River är en global ledare inom programvara för uppdragskritiska intelligenta system. Deras produkter och lösningar används inom flera branscher, inklusive flyg, försvar, industri, medicin, bilindustri och telekommunikation. Wind River har varit en pionjär inom detta område i över fyra decennier och har utvecklat teknologier som driver miljarder system världen över. Deras programvara är känd för att erbjuda högsta nivåer av säkerhet, tillförlitlighet och prestanda, vilket är avgörande för applikationer som kräver hög precision och pålitlighet. Wind River har fått branschens erkännande för sin teknologiska innovation, sitt ledarskap och sin arbetsplatskultur – de har dessutom utsetts till en “Top Workplace” i tio år i rad via Great Place to Work.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 




 Som Territory Account Manager (TAM) arbetar du med Norden som arbetsplats för att erbjuda flyg- och försvarsindustrin med Wind Rivers unika programvarulösningar, professionella tjänster och utbildning till nya och befintliga kunder, prospekt och partners. Du kommer att arbeta nära Field Application Engineers i Norden och samarbeta med andra team inom försäljning, service, teknik, marknadsföring och produktledning. Fokus i denna roll är att aktivt bearbeta och etablera nya kunder i Norden.
 



  





 Denna roll rapporterar till Head of Sales, Aerospace & Defense, EMEA och är placerad på Wind Rivers kontor i Kista.
 



  





 Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 


* Utforska och etablera nya affärsmöjligheter i Norden; skapa leads, etablera kontakt och analysera marknaden för nya affärsmöjligheter.
* Hantera hela säljcykeln från start till mål.
* Stärka relationer med nya och befintliga kunder.
* Förstå kunders nuvarande och framtida behov.
* Hantera tekniska produktdemonstrationer och möten.
* Samarbeta med kollegor och team för att uppnå mål.
* Bygga och hantera försäljningsprognoser.
* Granska försäljningskontrakt och juridiska dokument.



  





**OM DIG** 




 Vi söker en dynamisk, ambitiös och erfaren säljare som både kan generera leads och etablera nya kundrelationer såväl som projektleda långsiktiga kundrelationer på ett framgångsrikt sätt. Du är kreativ, tekniskt nyfiken och självgående med erfarenhet av att hantera tekniska försäljningscykler. Du älskar att lära dig om tekniska lösningar och produkter och att kommunicera deras värde till kunder.
 



  





 Vi tror att har:
 


* 4+ års erfarenhet av teknisk försäljning mot flyg- och försvarsindustrin.
* Dokumenterad framgång i att uppnå försäljningsmål.
* Starka prospekteringsfärdigheter – en “hunter” som sporras av att etablera nya kontakter och vinna affärer.
* Professionell arbetsmoral och integritet.
* Erfarenhet av inbäddad programvara och molninfrastruktur är ett plus.
* Talar och skriver utmärkt engelska och svenska (andra nordiska språk är ett plus).
* Akademisk examen



  





**Varför välja Wind River?** 




 Har du nyligen flugit eller använt en mobiltelefon? Chansen är stor att Wind Rivers produkter gjorde det möjligt. Vill du arbeta med teknologier som finns i nästa flygplan, autonoma bil, AI-robot eller rymdfarkost? Vi erbjuder möjligheter att utveckla din karriär och bli utmanad professionellt tillsammans med ett mycket engagerat och proffsigt gäng. Ta möjligheten och ansök till Wind River idag!
 



  





**ANSÖKAN** 




 Ansök genom “Apply”-funktionen. Wind River samarbetar med rekryteringsföretaget Skoog Stjerna i denna rekrytering. Ansök med CV och några rader om varför du är den hunter som vi söker. Urvalet sker löpande.
 



  





 Har du några frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Ken Skoog på +46 70-444 38 80 eller Mary Bjelkemyr på +46 70-733 28 19.

title: Infra- Database Engineer
description:
Are you an ambitious Database Engineer eager to embark on a journey of managing complex database systems within a global technology ecosystem? We are looking for a skilled individual to join our team!
   

  

**About Betsson Group's Product Development**
 Our Product Development organization operates on a global scale, with cross-functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs located in Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv, and Athens. Our Product Development is comprised of nearly 600 dedicated professionals. Our talented Area Teams collaborate across geographical boundaries to drive innovation and deliver exceptional technology solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Be Involved With**
* Working with cutting-edge technology enabling our Cloud Journey.
* The Database team is responsible for building and managing Database hosting capabilities using Infrastructure as Code for all our platform needs. Database capabilities span from on-prem servers to cloud servers and DBaaS.
* Building our Database Infrastructure Platforms with our developers and providing guidance and tooling to handle distributed systems.
* Continuously improving, tuning, and optimizing our Database platform capabilities based on business needs. Analyzing, diagnosing, and solving issues of efficiency and performance.


**We Are Seeking Individuals Who Possess**
* Proficiency in setting up and administering AWS database services, including SQL and NoSQL databases, both as DBaaS and Elastic Compute models.
* Strong expertise in managing PostgreSQL and Microsoft SQL Server databases, including administration, optimization, and high availability configurations.
* Familiarity with cloud providers, with a preference for AWS, and knowledge of cloud provider services such as Aurora, DynamoDB, and RDS.
* Experience with scalable and distributed database infrastructure.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions.
* Adaptability to changing technologies and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
* Support and implement the backup, recovery, and high availability strategies are crucial for data protection, with configurations for failover and replication.
* DBAs monitor and fine-tune database performance, apply patches and updates, and automate routine tasks through scripting.
* Capacity planning and disaster recovery planning ensure scalability and business continuity.


**Also Meritorious Skills**
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, with a solid understanding of Terraform modules and workflows.
* Skill in version control to manage code changes effectively.
* Familiarity with open-source monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, PowerShell, or similar.
* Experience in using and managing Linux distributions.


 If you're passionate about database engineering and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply and become part of our dynamic team!
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 What else would you expect from a business of 75% millennial, 10% GenX, 70+ nationalities, equal opportunity employer where 40% of our workforce are women and growing. More than 2500 strong professionals spread across 13 offices.
   

  

 Challenge Accepted?
   

  

***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: (Senior) Financial Risk Application Engineer / Service Manager (CompatibL) - based in Poland
description:
The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its newly created Centre of Excellence, a
 **(** 
**Senior) Financial Risk Application Engineer / Service Manager (CompatibL) – based in Poland** 
**\*** 
 . This position will be part of
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) – Business Solutions Department (BSD)** 
**-** 
 located in the
 **EIB External Office in Warsaw, Poland** 
 .
   

  

**This is a full-time temporary position at grade 5/6 in Warsaw, Poland. The term of the contract will be 4 years.**
* internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications


 Purpose
   

  

 Are you ready to contribute to a sustainable future and be at the heart of the European Union's Climate Bank's digital evolution? The European Investment Bank (EIB) is on a strategic mission to integrate advanced IT technologies, enhancing our business efficacy and the interaction experience with our clients and partners. Our Digital Transformation's success is energized by the diverse array of our team's skills, profound expertise, and dedication to bringing our forward-thinking vision to life. While we’re headquartered in the vibrant city of Luxembourg, we’re excited to establish a Centre of Excellence in the dynamic hub of Warsaw!
   

  

 The EIB is embarking on a transformative journey from on-premise solutions to cloud-based service management. You'll play a crucial role in redefining our Financial Risk Application IT landscape , working with state-of-the-art technologies and platforms like CompatibL. This role is an unique opportunity to be at the forefront of IT transformation of the EU Climate Bank, bringing your creativity to a better future of the EU and beyond.
   

  

 Your mission? To play a key role in managing the full lifecycle of application development and support, develop and implement strategies for effective operation and support, and guiding the application's migration towards the cloud and/or service-oriented relationship with the vendor including managing the service post-migration. You will coordinate the planning, execution, and operations with precision, to ensure optimal alignment with our digital strategy, developing the foundations of our cloud platform.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of Department. You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. As you will be based in Warsaw some business travel to the EIB Headquarters in Luxembourg is foreseen.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Oversee daily IT operations in collaboration with the business stakeholders including vendors, ensuring high availability and optimal performance of critical applications
* Provide comprehensive technical support and custom development, enhancing application functionality
* Lead technical coordination in infrastructure projects, including the setup and configuration of containerized environments
* Manage technical projects, ensuring effective coordination with business users and IT teams to deliver timely results
* Ensure the CompatibL applications meet the high standards expected by Finance and Risk business users, focusing on efficiency and user satisfaction.
* Continuously optimise the application system architecture, proposing scalable, resilient, and high-performance solutions
* Establish and maintain SLAs, KPIs, and effective communication channels with vendors and/or managed services providers, ensuring service excellence
* Proactively monitor service health, initiating rapid interventions to maintain or restore service quality
* Drive the development and implementation of service strategies to improve customer experience and achieve service objectives
* Foster strong relationships with vendors and service providers, ensuring collaborative and effective service management
* Lead cloud migration strategies in collaboration with technical teams, ensuring robust, secure, and compliant cloud operations
* Stay abreast of industry trends and standards in cloud and managed services, championing best practices across the organization


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
* At least 5 years of experience in technical support / managing IT projects within a banking or finance with a strong understanding of application lifecycle
* Experience with managing the full application lifecycle, including incident management, troubleshooting, and escalation prioritisation
* Good knowledge of cloud principles. Experience with managing migrations to major public clouds would be an asset (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
* Good technical background in any of the scripting languages (Unix shell, Python, PL-SQL, JavaScript, PowerShell) and DBMS Systems (e.g. Oracle, Sybase, MongoDB)
* Experience in conducting regular service reviews, collecting feedback, and making continuous improvements
* Strong coordination and communication skills, with the ability to work transversally and manage vendor relationships effectively
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
**Additional Information**
 The remuneration of staff hired directly at a post in an external office within the EU may be adapted to the costs of living of the respective country. Please follow the link We invest in you.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**Deadline for applications:** 
 This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until the positions are filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

title: Northern Europe Technology Development Lead
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet** 




 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do.
