We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at
 
 dnb.com/careers
 
 .
 



  





**About the role** 




 The Northern Europe Technology Development Lead will be responsible for the strategy, ownership and delivery for a number of our key Local Markets (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Estonia and Latvia). This role is the pivotal partner for our business units in the segment on those markets, understanding the Business initiatives, potential opportunities and Technology requirements and owning the delivery from Technology to meet those Business Objectives.
 



  





 In addition to delivering for our business units, this role will be responsible for the modernization of the local markets within Northern Europe. Understanding the Technology platforms and organizational structure and defining the strategies for modernizing those platforms and bringing them together. D&B is growing rapidly within the Northern Europe markets and as a result we are looking for a Leader who can continue to drive and evolve our platforms to keep pace with this growth.
 



  





 Owning the strategy, approach and outcomes for these markets will be challenging as each local market has its own Business Deliverables, challenges and platforms to modernize. This will require a comprehensive mix of Technology skills, primarily as a leader you will need to define and drive the North Star for the Northern Europe markets. This will require heavy strategic thinking and direction, coupled with the fact that there is a large and complex delivery book of work. This role will be owning all of this and tracking/driving these markets and the programmes within them, so programme management and governance is imperative. Understanding and managing the cost base for the area will require good budget management capabilities, with the incumbent responsible for the budget, delivery within it and driving innovation to deliver more efficiently.
 



  





 Our platforms underpin some of the more complex businesses in Northern Europe and so require good knowledge of cloud-based technologies, microservices and high availability platforms. Finally excellent communication and stakeholder skills are required as the incumbent will be expected to provide domain management and updates to the full Northern Europe team.
 



  





 This role is fundamental for D&B International. Reporting into Senior Director Local Markets Europe and working close to the Senior Director Technology Development Strategic Products Europe you will be responsible for one of our largest and most complex markets, and to ensure that they continue to be successful whilst managing the modernization of Technology with zero impact to each market.
 



  





 This role will ensure that D&B can meet the needs of our ever-growing set of clients, products and data so it is a vital portion of our Technology transformation.
 



 Delivering on those technical commitments to meet our commercial objectives and responsible for keeping the European Leadership Team and other stakeholders updated on progress.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Overall E2E ownership for the Technology Functions within the Northern Europe Markets.
* Stakeholder management for the Northern Europe markets, representing Technology in the Northern Europe Leadership team and representing the markets for Technology.
* Working in partnership with the Local Market Leads, define, track and manage these projects to ensure delivery to budget and committed timelines.
* Develop the strategy and process for modernizing the Northern Europe markets, including product, resourcing and back office.
* Develop the vendor and location strategies for the domain, looking to utilize Technology centers in addition to the local market resource.
* Ensuring SLAs, metrics and continuous improvement measures are in place and can be demonstrated.
* Manage a significant domain budget, understanding, challenging, and proactively managing their cost and time position to mitigate potential delays and identify efficiencies.
* Identify any dependencies, risks and issues and ensure mitigation plans in place.
* Work closely with regional representatives from multiple global teams to ensure an effective cross-functional approach.
* Act as pivotal connection between the Technology delivery team and the commercial business to ensure requirements and timelines are understood and aligned.
* Coach, develop and challenge project teams (direct reports or otherwise) to a successful implementation.
* Effectively communicate timely and relevant updates to multiple stakeholder groups including International Technology and the European Leadership Team



  





**Key Attributes** 



* Proven track record of leading a major Technology programme across multiple countries as a senior project director or lead preferably within a large organization.
* Strong project management and organizational skills with experience of managing complex projects and performance management of suppliers.
* Strong Technology background – knowledge of agile delivery practices, large scale data platforms and Java
* Ability to define and implement KPI’s around quality, efficiency and delivery for large distributed scrum teams.
* Exceptional multi-tasker, strategic and tactical thinker
* Ability to prioritize and adapt while maintaining the highest attention to detail.
* Able to shape, lead and control the delivery of complex, cross-functional projects, including optimization of resources and delivery to challenging timescales.
* Relationship management, able to build and maintain effective working relationships and work collaboratively with a wide range of colleagues.
* Understanding of relevant data legislation and privacy compliance across Europe



  





**Skills** 



* 10+ years of experience of Leadership experience relating to critical Domains or Programmes.
* Extensive project management skills with a focus on business-centric projects
* Ability to develop governance methodologies as an integral part of successful program execution.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of leaders, managers, and subject matter experts.
* Able to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
* Demonstrable skills in presenting information effectively and delivering effective reporting mechanisms.
* Able to produce high quality, effective and thorough documentation.
* Able to manage and prioritize competing requirements.
* Fluent in Swedish and English language



  





  





 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at
 
 https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html
 
 and
 
 https://jobs.lever.co/dnb
 
 . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.

title: Konsultuppdrag | Data Engineer- Data infrastructure LDW
description:
**Job Description:** 




 We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will manage, maintain, and support our data infrastructure, ensuring seamless operation and effective incident and problem management.
   





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Support and Maintenance:
* Perform regular support and maintenance tasks.
* Conduct bug fixes and troubleshoot technical issues.
* Manage incidents and problems to minimize downtime.



**Technical Expertise:** 



* Utilize Azure SQL, ADLS, ADF, SSIS, SSAS, PowerApp, and LogicApp.
* Leverage advanced SQL skills for data manipulation and optimization.
* Implement automation with Terraform.
* Develop data transformation workflows with DBT.
* Apply Python for data processing and analytics.
* Basic knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Qualifications:
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Hands-on experience with Azure SQL, ADLS, ADF, SSIS, SSAS, PowerApp, and LogicApp.
* Advanced SQL skills.
* Proficiency in Python.
* Experience with DBT.
* Knowledge of Terraform.
* Basic understanding of GCP.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and teamwork skills.







**Required cloud certification:** 
 AZ900
   

  





**Om oss** 




**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**
*Läs vidare på* 
*www.senterprise.se*

title: Expert IT Architect, Credit Risk/Workflow/Collateral
description:
**Job ID: 22733** 






  
 





 Would you like to grab a challenging and exciting opportunity to shape the future of Nordea’s Credit Risk & Collateral Domain in Group Architecture? We are now looking for an Expert IT Architect to provide architectural support and direction across the enterprise.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  
 





  
 





**About the role** 






  
 





 The Credit & Collateral Architecture team is expanding and seeking experienced an Expert IT Architect to help define the target architecture vision for the domain and conceptualise the same in transitional steps that can then be delivered through working software across the full SDLC. This manifest itself in the ability to govern, mentor and overseeing the design and implementation work managed through other architecture / engineering resources and developers. You will work as a trusted business advisor and help shaping the strategy, develop technology implementation options, and engineer solutions that achieve the business and technology objectives.
 





  

  



**Primary Responsibilities:** 





* Lead and manage the credit risk domain projects through all phases of the project lifecycle from defining the strategic roadmap with business, developing the technology blueprint, planning the phased IT implementation, setting up the team and the governance structures related to the production rollout /project activities.
* Ability to translate strategic goals through transitional delivery steps, even if that implies justified technical debt to achieve the business outcome.
* Lead Credit Risk and Collateral domain project with blended onshore/offshore teams that range in size from 5 to 25 team members.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders across all business touch points in the domain related to channel integration, pricing, analytics, decisioning, debt collection, scoring and risk modelling.
* In-depth and experienced understanding of operational credit risk functions and capabilities in context of lending products and services in banking and /or insurance.
* Influence the business and technology direction at the divisional or enterprise level based on broad expertise across multiple software platforms and technologies.
* Conduct "Whiteboard", knowledge and requirements gathering sessions with clients through the conceptualisation, design and implementation of new systems, middleware/API, and business intelligence solutions/ reporting solutions.​





 You’ll join a team of experienced architects. The role is based in Helsinki; Gdańsk; Gdynia; Stockholm; Warszawa.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 







*Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage.* 
 These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 




**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 





* Ability to communicate technical concepts in simple terms; must be comfortable presenting solution design concepts and guiding solution design discussions / sessions.
* Ability to work independently, as well as guide and mentor other team members, partners and customers.
* Strong executive presence and ability to interact with senior executives.
* Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes, but is not limited to only SAFe.





**Qualifications:** 





* 10+ years of related work experience in the areas related to the Credit Risk domain i.e. Collateral Management, Debt Collection, Default Management, Risk Modelling, Regulatory Reporting, Decisioning, Scoring, Rating, Data Governance, Business Intelligence and/or Data Warehousing.
* A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in a client-facing consulting delivery role managing in an onsite / offshore delivery model with emphasis on collaborative working through use of virtual teams.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 15/08/2024
 



 . For more information about the position please contact Hiring Leader Shabbir Contractor at shabbir.contractor@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden - for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Senior Business Development Manager
company: DEK Technologies Sweden an Endava Company
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior New Business Development & Management Professional with a proven track record of excellence and over-achievement in driving profitable growth and transformation within the Telecoms Software Services markets to join our highly successful global Telco team.
 



  





 This opportunity will suit someone with a demonstrable track record of originating and closing offshore/nearshore IT Services engagements with the gravitas to engage at C-level across major telecommunications organizations
 



  





 You must understand the concepts and key messages behind Agile and Digital Services and have sold full life cycle of software development (Consulting, Development, Testing, Support).
 



  





 Preference will be given to those with an established network and prior experience with Sweden's leading telecom company as well as a solid record of exceeding sales targets.
 



  





**Main Focus** 




  




* Major focus on closing ‘Big Ticket’ deals
* Proven record of exceeding sales/revenue targets, resulting in consistent above target performance within sales career at personal and managerial levels
* Specialties: Telecommunication including Tier 1 mobile operators
* Team Player able to motivate and drive individuals and teams to consistently over- achieve and grow
* Identification and acquisition of new clients and projects in the sector
* Self-Starter with end-to-end ownership of the sales process from acquisition to completion
* Relationship management, maintenance, and use of your existing network
* Individual bidding as well as coordination and participation in contract negotiations
* Internal coordination of the support and other teams, also abroad
* Use of marketing tools to obtain new orders
* Participation ,moderation and management of external events



  





**Skills Required** 




  




* 8+ years of professional sales experience at a senior level
* Experience in sales of offshore or nearshore / IT Services
* Self -Starter with structured work ethic
* Results orientated & commercially focused



  





**Essential** 
 :
 



  




* Fluent English/ Swedish
* Multi - year experience in ‘Technical’ sales with a thorough understanding of IT services, principles and practices
* Understands and demonstrates a systematic approach to problem solving
* Communicates fluently and effectively in business writing and present information to both technical and non-technical audiences, Swedish and English
* Able to plan, schedule, and monitor own work within deadlines
* Maintains awareness of developing technologies and takes some responsibility for personal development
* Possess technical and commercial background, persistence, and persuasiveness needed to succeed in a sales role
* Strong experience of methods and techniques for preparing and presenting proposals, business cases, and statements of work



  





**Highly Desirable:** 




  




* Experience of recent work with, selling to or for large Telecom companies
* Experience of working with MNOs, MVNOs
* Experience of Cloud, 5g, IOT, Embedded Software, Dev, Test



  





**Offer and Benefits:** 



* Uncapped Commission-with high earning potential
* Opportunity to work & travel in an international high growth environment
* Career development opportunities.
* Clear and regular promotion opportunities based on exceeding targets
* Ongoing training development and managerial support
* Highly Competitive salary & Share save scheme
* Comprehensive benefits package



  





**DEK Technologies an Endava Company** 
 is reimagining the relationship between people and technology.
 



  





 We support some of the world’s leading Payments, Financial Services,
 **Telecommunications,** 
 Media, Technology, Consumer Products, Retail, Mobility, and Healthcare companies to accelerate their ability to take advantage of new business models and market opportunities. By ideating and delivering dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences, we help our clients fuel the rapid, ongoing transformation of their business.
 



  





 Come and be part of our journey!

title: Är du vår nästa Analytics Consultant?
description:
Vi letar nu efter fler kollegor till vår växande grupp datakonsulter; personer som gillar att skapa magi genom data & analys!
   

  

 Våra närmare 200 dataexperter jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier, både med och utan cloud. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

 Såhär beskriver vår Viz-konsult Alexandra sitt nuvarande projekt:
   

  

 “Jag hjälper kunden att utveckla en app för att följa upp kostnader i stora projekt, för att se till att man ligger i linje med budgeten och fakturerar enligt plan. Mitt uppdrag hos kunden kommer att breddas framöver då jag nyligen hjälpt till att göra en kartläggning av Power BI-behov i hela verksamheten. Vi har bland annat hittat behov inom kvalitet och hållbarhetsredovisning – vilket jag tycker är extra spännande då det knyter an till mitt intresse för området. Det bästa med uppdraget är samarbetet – jag är del av ett Scrum-team bestående av bolagets egna it-medarbetare och användare. Det är också tryggt att ha Solitas community i ryggen, jag vet att jag aldrig är ensam, det finns alltid hjälp att få av kollegorna”
   

  

**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
* Du diskuterar gärna datavisualiseringar och databaser, och bygger inspirerande dashboards
* Du kan implementera datalösningar som fungerar både för dataexperter och beslutsfattare på företag
* Du lär dig gärna nya teknologier och metoder
* Du är bekant med och/eller är nyfiken på teknologier som Tableau, Power BI och SQL


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**På Solita Får Du**
* Projekt som skapar riktiga avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället
* Nya teknologier
* En arbetskultur med hög självständighet och tillit
* Variation: i projekt, i teknologier, i angreppsätt
* Personlig utveckling och möjligheten att lära sig både från erfarna experter och våra interna utbildningssatsningar och communities
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med bl.a. 30 semesterdagar, fredagsfrukostar, aw:s, bike leasing, inhouse coach, yoga på kontoret, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet


 Blev du nyfiken? Hör av dig till oss!
   

  

***Solita är ett nordiskt företag som jobbar med digital transformation, styrd av data och mänsklig expertis. Vi har kontor i Sverige, Finland, Tyskland, Estland, Belgien och Danmark.***

title: QA Lead - Scandic Hotels Group
description:
**Please note, we are on vacation and will not be able to connect with you before mid-August. We wish you a lovely summer!**



We want a QA Lead to check in with us in Stockholm, Sweden!


At Scandic Hotels we’re on an exciting journey of digital transformation. 2023 marked another record year with strong results and high momentum in Scandic’s development. We are commercially and financially stronger than ever, and we’re now accelerating the pace to grow the portfolio and excel within digitalization. With a lot of curiosity and a truly customer-centric approach we aim to develop the next generation of digital experiences for our guests.


As we are developing our new digital platforms, we are on a mission to accelerate our test automation efforts to ensure seamless customer experiences.


As our QA Lead, you will be responsible for our QA processes and work closely with cross-functional development teams and product owners throughout the development lifecycle. You will work both strategically and hands-on to drive both manual and automated testing efforts. This role includes coordinating test processes, driving automation and continuously improving our QA processes.


This position centers around web and app development and involves collaboration within the entire Customer Journey tech organization including CRM/Loyalty and API/Integration teams. You will collaborate with developers, tech leads, designers, product owners and business stakeholders to ensure a high quality across web and app customer experiences.


**Main Activities:**


* Lead a team of QA engineers, coordinating efforts throughout the entire development lifecycle.
* Ensure a high bar for quality and reliability within the QA team
* Strategically and operationally collaborate on manual and automated testing, including both high-level strategic planning and hands-on execution of testing activities.
* Continuously improve our test process and drive automation forward.
* Engage with various teams to enhance the overall customer experience.

  
**Who are you?**


* Previous experience working as a QA Engineer or QA Lead for web.
* Know your way around a common testing framework, like Selenium, Playwright or Cypress.
* A good understanding of software architecture, and how they are designed
* Experience with agile ways of working
* Experience from e-com and/or hospitality would be a big plus
* ISTQB certification would be advantageous
Full working proficiency in English  
* 

**About** **Scandic:**



Scandic is the largest Nordic hotel operator with a network of about 280 hotels with 58,000 hotel rooms in operation and under development in six countries. Scandic Friends is the biggest loyalty program in the Nordic hotel sector. A lot of things are boiling at Scandic and we’re looking forward to some exciting and eventful years!


Scandic Hotels is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. We have a long legacy of driving sustainability action in the hospitality industry. With around 20 000 team members, over 10 million guests and 4 million meetings a year – we have great power to drive transformation and inspire change at scale, for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.


Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces, of course with a wonderful hotel vibe :) right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen 167 in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.


**How** **to Apply:**



We’re happy to see that you’ve made it this far, we can’t wait to get to know you better!


We welcome applications in either Swedish or English.


We are not able to provide any relocation assistance and will therefore only accept applicants already based in Sweden.


Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our website.


We're excited to hear from you soon!


Keywords: QA Engineer, QA Lead, automation, web, app, Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, hospitality, customer experience, quality assurance, reliability.


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Professional and personal development


Partner discounts


Family & Friends discounts


Discounts when eating, drinking & staying with us


Flexible office working hours


Competitive pension scheme

title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


Sustainability including climate change are the challenges of our generation. Our contribution is to offer leading transport and infrastructure solutions enabling societies to prosper in a sustainable way.


Electrification is a key enabler for carbon neutral road transport. Using hydrogen as a carrier of green electricity to power electric trucks is part of the solution and a complement to battery electric vehicles and renewable fuels.


Powertrain Strategic Development has the responsibility to explore and develop new sustainable propulsion solutions, including hydrogen-based propulsion technologies. We are highly skilled engineers acting in an exciting global environment which provides opportunities to develop both professionally and personally.


Do you want to join us on this journey? Together we will shape the world we want to live in!

 **We are now recruiting a Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Engineer for Fuel Cell Electric Propulsion Solutions**


The Fuel Cell Electric Propulsion is a sensitive system with respect to performance and durability due to interdependent and complex components. In addition to the physical topology of the Fuel Cell Electric Propulsion system, advanced control is a vital element to leverage the full performance potential of the system and at the same time fulfill the durability requirements.


As a Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Engineer you will develop simulation models, perform high-level as well as detailed and complex simulation and analysis, and take responsibility for the fidelity of the results through all stages of the product development, from concept development to feature verification. You will invent and implement new simulation tools and methods within Advanced Propulsion technologies.

**Who are you?**
----------------


To be successful in this role and enjoy your work we believe that you have a broad technical background in a powertrain domain area with expert knowledge in automotive simulation tools, are passionate about mathematical modelling, complex simulations, and analysis of big amount of data.


You are exploratory and innovative with the ability to drive things to completion, which means that being proactive and willing to take ownership is something you enjoy. Since we are a global organization, it is important that you are fluent in spoken and written English, like teamwork and interaction with people and that you can communicate effectively.

  

Other skills that would be beneficial for this role are:

* Ms.c in Engineering with focus on Mathematical Modelling & Simulation
* Team player with the mindset to support others and ask for help when needed
* Action oriented and eager to actively learn new technology
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Join our dynamic team where innovation meets passion! If you are ready to make a meaningful impact, apply now and be a vital part of our journey towards a carbon neutral road transport. Let us shape the future together – your talents can be the catalyst for our success!

  

Curious and have some questions?  

Behrooz Razaznejad, Director for Software Solutions, behrooz.razaznejad@volvo.com


Due to summer vacations, all questions regarding the process and applications will be reviewed from the 12th of august. Please do not expect any communication earlier than this. We look forward to receiving your application!


Last application date 14th of july.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Scrum Master - Vehicle Services Core - Volvo Group Connected Solutions
description:
**We are committed to be a driving force in the transition to efficient, fossil-free and safe means of transport. Great progress is achieved by connecting great people, because together, we shape the world we want to live in.**

  

At Volvo Group Connected Solutions, we believe that connectivity is the key to making a difference. With vast amounts of data, we are pushing boundaries for what connectivity can do in a transforming industry.

**The Position**
----------------

As Scrum Master in the Vehicle Services Core team, you will be in a combined Scrum Master and Developer role, focusing mainly on tasks related to the Scrum Master role. We work DevSecOps, whereas you will frequently interact with, other than the Java Developers in your own team, several other teams both at Volvo Group Connected Solutions (VGCS) and other parts of Volvo in common deliveries. In other words, you will be working with e.g. other Scrum Masters, Support team members, Business Analysts, E2E Testers – to mention a few.

  

Your responsibilities will, among other things, involve having daily follow up with the team and report to e.g Release Train Engineer and Product Owner on both one-time and run-time status. We work according to SAFE with Program Increments and we use Confluence and Jira tools. The team is responsible for several backend services in the VGCS telematic platform e.g Over the Air updates (OTA).

 **What we can offer you**

  

You will be part of a company that will engage your curiosity and empower you to take action. We show ownership and collectively take responsibility for the total delivery. Furthermore, we offer a solid benefits package, flexible work arrangements and possibilities to grow.

  

We are located at Lindholmen Science Park in Gothenburg’s tech hub Lindholmen, in the heart of the automotive cluster.

  

This role will give you an opportunity to take ownership of a very important part of VGCS telematics platform and contribute to future growth of Volvo services. You will contribute to the delivery of several of Volvos Uptime services. In this role you will have the opportunity to create a broad network within Volvo Group.

**Your profile**
----------------

We are looking for someone with experience from being a Scrum Master but also have a background in Java programming and the software development process. It is a plus if you also have experience in AWS. We also work with for example Linux, GIT and Spring Boot. You should be able to handle requirements from several parallel initiatives and be able to translate to a realistic planning within the team. You are a communicative person and used to handle stakeholders such as Project Managers, Domain architects, Line managers, Product owners etc. You also have an interest in growing people and develop the team to both being a great place to work and make sure to deliver in time.

 **Want to know more? Contact us!**

  

Please contact Anna-Karin Johansson, +46 739 028989

  

Last application date is: 08/16/2024

  

Please note that due to vacation period we wont look at applications or initiate contact before the last application date.

title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
**We are** **Grepit** a leading technology company, that focuses on software- and hardware solutions and cutting-edge projects that push the boundaries of technology. At Grepit AB, innovation meets reality and technology opens doors to endless possibilities.

  

We are now searching for a highly skilled and experienced Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our team and lead various RnD projects. In this role, you will be pivotal in designing, developing, and implementing innovative mechanical systems. You will be part of a team handling the entire design process from prototyping to final product development. As a senior team member, you will engage in hands-on design work and mentor junior engineers. Your expertise will be crucial in interfacing with customers and stakeholders to meet and exceed project requirements.


**What you’ll do:**

Design and development of mechanical systems from prototype to production-ready design, ensuring high standards of performance, reliability, and efficiency.


* Mentor and guide junior engineers, providing technical direction and fostering a collaborative team environment.
* Interface with customers and stakeholders to understand project requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure successful project delivery.
* Conduct thorough analysis and testing of mechanical systems to validate performance and ensure compliance with industry standards.
* Collaborate with other teams to integrate mechanical designs with other system components.

**Your profile:**

* You have proven experience in designing and developing mechanical systems.
* You are proficient in using CAD software and other engineering tools for design and analysis such as Fusion 360, Siemens NX, Catia in a product development environment.
* You have experience in GD&T, PLM-systems, and best practices thereof.
* You have experience in design for manufacturing.
* You prefer to work in teams and are comfortable with a fast-paced work environment with tight deadlines.
* You have strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* You have good interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interface with customers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams.
* You have strong communication skills in English and Swedish (written and spoken).

**It is a plus if you:**

* Have a MSc or PhD in Mechanical Engineering
* Experience in leading and mentoring a team of engineers, with excellent leadership and communication skills.
* Have experience from developing battery systems/high voltage electronics
* You have experience with renewable energy systems

**What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work in a hybrid position, with flexibility to work partly in our office in Luleå, Umeå or Gothenburg and partly remotely.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Career growth and development opportunities within our company.

**How to Apply:** At Grepit AB, we are always on the lookout for creative minds and skilled professionals to join our dynamic team. If you are a skilled Rust Developer with a passion for technology and a commitment to excellence, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please fill in the form with your resume and cover letter and we will get back to you!


Grepit AB is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Let’s collaborate and create a future where technology knows no limits. Join Grepit AB and be part of something extraordinary.

title: Instrument Operations Engineer
description:
The European Spallation Source is one of the largest science and technology infrastructure projects being built today. The project includes the most powerful linear proton accelerator ever built, a five-tonne, helium-cooled tungsten target wheel, state-of-the-art neutron instruments, a suite of laboratories, and a data management and software development centre. It is a brand-new Big Science organisation and we are building it from the ground up.



The ESS will be a user facility, welcoming researchers from around the world to perform experiments using the neutron instruments and associated facilities. We currently expect to have first neutron production in 2025 and welcome our first external users in 2027.



We are now looking for an **Instrument Operations Engineer** for the DREAM instrument. The position is with the Diffraction & Imaging Division.


**About the division**



The Diffraction & Imaging Division consists of the scientific staff that are leading the instrument construction projects and the staff that will eventually execute the day-to-day operations of six neutron instruments. The upcoming responsibilities of the division are


* Finalize installation of the instruments
* Plan and implement further developments and upgrades of the instruments
* Commissioning of the instruments, both with and without neutrons
* Deliver state-of-the-art scientific capabilities for internal and external users to enable the wider science community to advance science and technology
* Push the state-of-the-art capabilities of neutron instrumentation making maximum benefit from the ESS source.


**About the role**



As an **Instrument Operations Engineer** you will:


* Join a team of scientists, engineers, and technicians aiming to prepare a neutron instrument for first user operation and beyond
* Collaborate closely with engineers and technicians in specialist disciplines at ESS


Between now and the start of commissioning with neutrons (“hot commissioning”):


* Prepare, execute, and document test plans for instrument components (“cold commissioning), working with the instrument scientist and engineer and in liaison with staff in specialist disciplines
* Support the instrument scientists in preparing safety documentation, including standard operating procedures and operations manuals for an instrument.
* Prepare for and participate in commissioning experiments at other facilities to test components for an instrument (e.g. testing of sample environment equipment)
* Participate in the mechanical design and realization of modifications to an instrument required during installation and testing
* Participate in the mechanical design and realization of equipment and setups needed for testing


After the start of hot commissioning:


* Support the instrument scientists in preparing, executing and documenting testing of an instrument with neutrons (“hot commissioning”)
* Plan, manage and/or execute scheduled and unscheduled maintenance of the instrument
* Act as the system owner for an instrument, keeping the maintenance records and engineering documentation up to date with changes.
	+ Responsiblity for instrument specific components
	+ Coordination with specialized technology groups (Choppers, Detectors, Motion Control, etc.) and support teams (vacuum, rigging, survey and alignment)
	+ Working with operational groups (Hall Coordinators, ESH, Control Room Operators)
* Participate in the mechanical design and realization of upgrades for an instrument
* Support user experiments on the instrument by e.g. building mechanical and/or electrical support systems in the in-house workshop, and helping to set-up sample environments, this includes:
	+ Writing and Review of Experiment Hazard Analyses
	+ Providing assistance in sample mounting
	+ Setting up of instrument configurations
	+ Assisting in user experiments, including training users on instrument operations

**About you**



We are looking for a self-motivated person who is keen to support an instrument team in order to get it ready for first neutrons. You should be a ‘hands-on’ person and open to learn new things along the way. You will have:


* A bachelor’s or masters degree in Engineering or the Physical Sciences, or equivalent technical experience
* Experience in the hands-on management of complex technical equipment
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to be able to interact effectively with a diverse group of scientists, engineers, and technical staff
* Excellent oral and written English skills


Physical requirements for this job include the use of hand, eye and ear protection gear, stooping, kneeling, lifting, and sitting or standing for extended periods of time.



Ideally, you will also have:


* Experience with neutron experiments and neutron scattering procedures
* Experience with the development, operation, and maintenance of complex scientific equipment
* Ability to perform simple mechanical design (CAD) and work with designers
* Knowledge of other European languages would be an advantage
* Experience in programming (python, Matlab, C++ or similar)
* Experience working in an international research environment


We are building ESS from the ground up, so we need someone who is comfortable not only following procedures, but also creating them. We attach great importance to personality and attitude, so we're looking for a real team player: Someone who is sociable, has excellent communication skills and who likes to collaborate with different people.


**What ESS will offer**

* an opportunity to contribute to the future of neutron science
* a workplace full of creative individuals and people from all over the world
* a challenging, exciting, and fast-paced work environment
* market competitive compensation that is individual and differentiated according to role, responsibilities, individual skills, abilities, and achievements
* benefits including 30 days of annual leave as well as more than 10 days of public holidays and company days off or days with limited working hours, flexible working arrangements, and a focus on work-life balance.
* where applicable, relocation support and allowances may be available.


**Duration & Location**



The position is a 3 year fixed-term role and the workplace will be situated in Lund, Sweden. Travelling is expected if the need arises.


**Application & Contact**



Please provide your curriculum vitae and cover letter in English . The deadline for applications is **09 August 2024.**



Note that we only accept applications via the ESS website or ESS intranet. Internal candidates are encouraged to apply through the intranet. We accept candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so please do not hesitate to apply.



Certain roles at ESS require health and safety checks and/or security clearance procedures, which will be performed as part of the recruitment process.



For further information regarding the position, please contact Mikhail Feygenson, Head of Diffraction and Imaging Division, Mikhail.Feygenson@ess.eu



For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Kathryn Quaak, HR Officer, Kathryn.Quaak@ess.eu.


*We look forward to receiving your application soon!*

title: Key Account Manager för svenska myndigheter - Sectra Communications
description:
Vill du spela en avgörande roll i att skydda Sveriges mest känsliga information? Här kommer en möjlighet att bli del av ett marknadsledande företag inom säkra system, som jobbar för att vi alla ska känna oss tryggare i samhället.
  
  

På Sectra Communications arbetar vi med utveckling av produkter och tjänster som bidrar till ett säkrare och tryggare samhälle både i Sverige och Europa. Vi utvecklar och säljer avancerade lösningar inom IT-kommunikation för att möta de höga krav som våra myndigheter och försvar ställer på säkerhet, användbarhet och tillgänglighet. Här får du möjligheten att använda dina färdigheter på riktigt, utmana dig själv och göra en skillnad i vårt samhälle.
  
  

Rollen

Våra lösningar för kritisk IT- och kommunikationssäkerhet spelar en nyckelroll i vårt uppdrag att stärka stabiliteten och effektiviteten i samhällets viktigaste funktioner. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara en del av denna fantastiska resa!

Ansvara för den kommersiella relationen med kunden och driva affärstillväxt.

Skills & Requirements
  
  

På Sectra värdesätter vi alltid viljan och förmågan att lära sig samt ta sig an nya uppgifter snabbt. Här är det viktigt att ha ett analytiskt sinne för att kunna förstå, bryta ner och lösa problem. Vidare tror vi att du är en bra kommunikatör som har förmågan att interagera med kollegor, partners och kunder på ett effektivt, tydligt och konstruktivt sätt.
  
  

**Utöver dessa färdigheter vill vi även att du:**

Har dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet som säljrepresentant eller Key Account Manager inom IT (lösningsförsäljning) eller försvarsindustrin (kontraspionage).
